 21 	/**	When called as a function, acts as an alias of {@link puredom.el}.<br />
 22 	 *	If a <code>Function</code> is passed, it is registered as a DOMReady handler. <br />
 23 	 *	Otherwise, all arguments are passed on to {@link puredom.el}.
 24 	 *	@version 1.3.0
 25 	 *	@namespace Core functionality
 26 	 *	@function
 27 	 *	@param {Function|Any} arg	If a <code>Function</code> is passed, it is registered as a DOMReady handler. Otherwise, all arguments are passed on to {@link puredom.el}
 28 	 *	@name puredom
 29 	 *	@public

 31 	var self = function(){
 32 			return priv.puredom.apply(priv, arguments);

 34 		/**	@private */
 35 		baseSelf = {
 36 			version : '1.3.0',
 37 			templateAttributeName : 'data-tpl-id',
 38 			baseAnimationInterval : 20,
 39 			allowCssTransitions : true,
 40 			easingMethods : {
 41 				'ease' : function(f) {
 42 					return (Math.sin(f*Math.PI - Math.PI/2) + 1) / 2;
 43 				},
 44 				'ease-in-out' : function(f) {
 45 					// note, this is not the correct easing function for ease-in-out
 46 					return (Math.sin(f*Math.PI - Math.PI/2) + 1) / 2;
 47 				},
 48 				'ease-in-out-2' : function(f) {
 49 					return this['ease-in-out'](this['ease-in-out'](f));
 50 				},
 51 				'ease-in-out-3' : function(f) {
 52 					return this['ease-in-out'](this['ease-in-out'](this['ease-in-out'](f)));
 53 				}
 54 			}

138 	getSupportedTextContentProperty = function() {
139 		var d = document.body;

147 	/** Extend/augment a base object with the properties of one or more additional objects.<br />
148 	 *	<strong>Note:</strong> all additional arguments are treated as additional Objects to copy properties from.
149 	 *	@param {Object} base	The object to extend. For cloning, use an object literal.
150 	 *	@param {Object} props	An Object to copy properties from.
151 	 *	@param {Object} [...]	Additional arguments also get copied onto base.
152 	 *	@returns {Object} base
153 	 *	@example
154 	 *		var clonedObj = puredom.extend({}, originalObj);
155 	 *		puredom.extend(MyClass.prototype, prototypeAsHash);
156 	 */
157 	self.extend = function(base) {
158 		var i, j, ext;
159 		base = base || {};
160 		for (i=1; i<arguments.length; i++) {
161 			ext = arguments[i];
162 			if (ext) {
163 				for (j in ext) {
164 					if (ext.hasOwnProperty(j)) {
165 						base[j] = ext[j];
166 					}
167 				}
168 				// IE never reports toString as an "own property", so manually check if it was copied and fix if required:
169 				if (typeof ext.toString==='function' && ext.toString!==Object.prototype.toString) {		// ext.toString!==obj.toString && 
170 					base.toString = ext.toString;
171 				}
172 			}
173 		}
174 		return base;
175 	};
176 	
177 	
178 	/** Mix functionality from one object into another. <br />
179 	 *	<strong>Note:</strong> all additional arguments are treated as additional Objects to copy properties from. <br />
180 	 *	<strong>Alternative Signature:</strong> <code>mixin(true, [props, ...], base)</code>
181 	 *	@param {Object} base	The object to extend. For cloning, use an object literal.
182 	 *	@param {Object} props	An Object to copy properties from, unless base already has a property of the same name.
183 	 *	@returns {Object} base
184 	 *	@example
185 	 *		// standard:
186 	 *		puredom.mixin(myObj, decorator1, decorator2);
187 	 *		
188 	 *		// alternative, decorator-first style:
189 	 *		puredom.mixin(true, decorator1, decorator2, myObj);
190 	 */
191 	self.mixin = function(base) {
192 		var i, j, ext,
193 			mix = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 1);
194 		if (base===true) {
195 			base = mix.pop();
196 		}
197 		base = base || {};
198 		for (i=0; i<mix.length; i++) {
199 			if ( (ext=mix[i]) ) {
200 				for (j in ext) {
201 					if (ext.hasOwnProperty(j) && !base.hasOwnProperty(j)) {
202 						base[j] = ext[j];
203 					}
204 				}
205 			}
206 		}
207 		return base;
208 	};

210 	
211 	/**	Strip an object of all of its properties.<br />
212 	 *	<strong>Note:</strong> Sets property values to null, doesn't actually delete them.
213 	 *	@param {Object} obj					An object to strip all properties from
214 	 *	@param {Boolean} [andProto=false]	If <code>true</code>, nullifies entire prototype chain.
215 	 */
216 	self.strip = function(obj, andProto) {
217 		for (var i in obj) {
218 			if (andProto===true || obj.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
219 				obj[i] = null;			// faster than delete.
220 			}
221 		}
222 	};

224 	
225 	/** Get a value from within a nested object. "Deep keys" use dot notation.
226 	 *	@param {Object} obj		The object to delve into.
227 	 *	@param {String} path	A dot-notated key to find within <code>obj</code>
228 	 *	@param {Boolean} [discardFirst=false]			If <code>true</code>, the first segment of <code>path</code> will be discarded.
229 	 *	@param {Boolean} [allowIncompleteMatch=false]	If <code>true</code>, returns the deepest reachable value, even if it is not a full path.
230 	 */
231 	self.delve = function(obj, path, discardFirst, allowIncompleteMatch) {
232 		var i = 0;
233 		path = path.split('.');
234 		if (discardFirst===true) {
235 			path.splice(0, 1);
236 		}
237 		while (i<path.length && obj && obj.hasOwnProperty(path[i])) {
238 			obj = obj[path[i]];
239 			i += 1;
240 		}
241 		if (i>=path.length || (allowIncompleteMatch===true && i>0)) {
242 			return obj;
243 		}
244 	};
245 	
246 	
247 	/**	Flatten a nested Object using underscore-delimited keys. (<code>foo_bar_baz</code>)
248 	 *	@param {Object} obj		The nested/deep object to flatten
249 	 *	@returns {Object} flat
250 	 */
251 	self.flattenObj = function(obj, prefix, depth, flat) {
252 		var i, p;
253 		prefix = prefix || '';
254 		depth = depth || 0;
255 		flat = flat || {};
256 		for (i in obj) {
257 			if (obj.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
258 				p = prefix ? (prefix+'_'+i) : i;
259 				if (self.isScalar(obj[i])) {
260 					flat[p] = obj[i];
261 				}
262 				else {
263 					self.flattenObj(obj[i], p, depth+1, flat);
264 				}
265 			}
266 		}
267 		if (!depth) {
268 			return flat;
269 		}
270 	};

272 	
273 	/** Inject arbitrarily nested template fields into a string of text. <br />
274 	 *	Fields are referenced like this:  {foo.bar.baz|truncate:300,byWord}<br />
275 	 *	<em><strong>Note:</strong> keys are CaSe-SeNsItIvE.</em>
276 	 *	@param {String} text				The text to template
277 	 *	@param {Object} fields				An object containing (nested) keys for replacement
278 	 *	@param {Boolean} [allowI18n=true]	Allow Internationalization using the engine referenced by {@link puredom.l18n}?
279 	 *	@returns {String} The templated text
280 	 */
281 	self.template = function(text, fields, allowI18n) {
282 		var templated,
283 			i18n;
284 		if (allowI18n!==false && self.i18n) {
285 			i18n = self.i18n;
286 		}
287 		templated = (text+'').replace(priv.regex.templateFieldToken, function(str, pre, id, filters) {
288 			var val;
289 			if (pre!=='\\' && id) {
290 				val = self.delve(fields, id);
291 				if (val) {
292 					if (i18n) {
293 						val = i18n(val) || val;
294 					}
295 					if (filters && filters.substring(0,1)==='|') {
296 						val = self.text.filter(val, filters.substring(1));
297 					}
298 					str = pre + val;
299 				}
300 				else {
301 					str = pre;
302 				}
303 			}
304 			else {
305 				str = pre;
306 			}
307 			return str;
308 		});
309 		return templated;
310 	};

313 	/** Simple prototypal inheritance.
314 	 *	@param {Function} baseClass		The base (child) class.
315 	 *	@param {Function} superClass	A class to inherit from.
316 	 *	@returns {Function} baseClass, for convenience
317 	 *	@example
318 	 * puredom.inherits(puredom.ControllerManager, puredom.EventEmitter);
319 	 */
320 	self.inherits = function(base, superClass) {
321 		function F(){}
322 		F.prototype = superClass.prototype;
323 		var proto = base.prototype;
324 		base.prototype = new F();
325 		puredom.extend(base.prototype, proto);
326 		base.prototype.constructor = base;
327 		base.prototype.__super = superClass;
328 	};

331 	/** Get the <strong>lowercase</strong> type (constructor name) of an object.<br />
332 	 *	<em><strong>Important Note:</strong> Unlike many other typeOf implementations, this method returns the name of an Object's constructor, rather than just "object".</em>
333 	 *	@param {Any} what		An object to analyze
334 	 *	@returns {String} type
335 	 *	@example
336 	 * puredom.typeOf({}) === 'object'
337 	 * puredom.typeOf([]) === 'array'
338 	 * puredom.typeOf(new Audio) === 'audio'
339 	 */
340 	self.typeOf = function(what) {
341 		if (what===undefined) {
342 			return 'undefined';
343 		}
344 		else if (what===null) {
345 			return 'null';
346 		}
347 		else if (what) {
348 			if (what.constructor===objConstructor) {
349 				return 'object';
350 			}
351 			else if (self.isArray(what)) {
352 				return 'array';
353 			}
354 		}
355 		//return String(typeof what).toLowerCase();
356 		return Object.prototype.toString.call(what).replace(priv.regex.parseObjectNameFromString,'$1').toLowerCase();
357 	};

360 	/** Determines if the passed object is scalar.
361 	 *	@param {Any} what		An object to analyze
362 	 *	@returns {Boolean} isScalar
363 	 */
364 	self.isScalar = function(what) {
365 		var type = self.typeOf(what);
366 		if (type==='undefined' || type==='null' || type==='number' || type==='string' || type==='boolean') {
367 			return true;
368 		}
369 		return false;
370 	};
371 	
372 	
373 	/* Index of an element within an array */
374 	if (!Array.prototype.indexOf || ([self]).indexOf(self)!==0) {
375 		try {
376 			/**	@ignore */
377 			Array.prototype.indexOf = function(what) {
378 				for (var x=0; x<this.length; x++) {
379 					if (this[x]===what) {
380 						return x;
381 					}
382 				}
383 				return -1;
384 			};
385 		}catch(arrayIndexErr){}
386 	}

389 	/**	Convert an Array-like object (having a length and numeric properties) into an Array.
390 	 *	@param {Any} obj		An Array-like object to convert
391 	 *	@returns {Array} array	The converted <code>Array</code> on success, or the original object <code>obj</code> on failure.
392 	 */
393 	self.toArray = function(obj) {
394 		var arr = [],
395 			len = obj && obj.length,
396 			x, p;
397 		if (len || len===0) {
398 			for (x=len; x--; ) {
399 				arr[x] = obj[x];
400 			}
401 		}
402 		else {
403 			x = 0;
404 			while (true) {
405 				if (obj.hasOwnProperty && obj.hasOwnProperty(x)) {
406 					arr.push(obj[x]);
407 				}
408 				else if (obj.hasOwnProperty && obj.hasOwnProperty(x+'')) {
409 					arr.push(obj[x+'']);
410 				}
411 				else {
412 					break;
413 				}
414 				x += 1;
415 			}
416 		}
417 		return arr;
418 	};

420 	
421 	/** Determine if the argument is an Array
422 	 *	@function
423 	 *	@param {Any} what		An object to analyze
424 	 *	@returns {Boolean} isArray	<code>true</code> if the object is an <code>Array</code>, otherwise <code>false</code>.
425 	 */
426 	self.isArray = Array.isArray ? function(what) {
427 		return Array.isArray(what);
428 	} : function(what) {
429 		return Object.prototype.toString.call(what)==="[object Array]";
430 	};

433 	/** Determine if an object has a direct property with the given name.
434 	 *	@param {Any} obj		An object to test
435 	 *	@param {String} prop	A property name to test
436 	 *	@returns {Boolean} hasOwnProperty
437 	 */
438 	self.hasOwnProp = function(obj, prop) {
439 		return Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(obj, prop);
440 	};

443 	/** Iterate over an object, calling an <code>iterator</code> function on each value.
444 	 *	@name puredom.forEach
445 	 *	@function
446 	 *	@param {Object|Array} obj		An object to iterate over.
447 	 *	@param {Function} iterator		A function to call for each value. Gets passed <code>(value, key)</code>.
448 	 *	@returns obj
449 	 */
450 	self.forEach = function(obj, iterator) {
451 		var i, r;
452 		if (self.isArray(obj)) {
453 			for (i=0; i<obj.length; i++) {
454 				r = iterator(obj[i], i);
455 				if (r===false) {
456 					break;
457 				}
458 			}
459 		}
460 		else {
461 			for (i in obj) {
462 				if (obj.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
463 					r = iterator(obj[i], i);
464 					if (r===false) {
465 						break;
466 					}
467 				}
468 			}
469 		}
470 		return obj;
471 	};
472

474 	self.foreach = self.forEach;

477 	/**	Set the innerHTML of an element, with fixes for various browser bugs
478 	 *	@private
479 	 *	@param {HTMLElement} el			An element whose content should be set
480 	 *	@param {String} html			The content to set
481 	 */
482 	self.setInnerHTML = function(el, html) {
483 		var frag, i;
484 		if (priv.support.html5) {
485 			el.innerHTML = html || '';
486 		}
487 		else {
488 			el.innerHTML = '';
489 			priv.html5div.innerHTML = html || '';
490 			frag = document.createDocumentFragment();
491 			for (i=priv.html5div.childNodes.length; i--; ) {
492 				frag.appendChild(priv.html5div.firstChild);
493 			}
494 			el.appendChild(frag);
495 		}
496 	};
497 	
498 	
499 	/** Create a DOM node from an Object description
500 	 *	@private
501 	 *	@param {Object} options			An object that describes how to construct the node
502 	 *	@param {HTMLElement} [parent]	Optional parent node to inject the newly constructed element into.
503 	 *	@returns {HTMLElement} node		Returns the created HTML element.
504 	 */
505 	self.createElement = function(options, parent) {
506 		var el, x, i, childFrag, processProp, insertedBefore;
507 		if (typeof options==='string') {
508 			childFrag = document.createElement('div');
509 			childFrag.innerHTML = options;
510 			for (i=0; i<childFrag.childNodes.length; i++) {
511 				el = childFrag.childNodes[i];
512 				if (el.nodeType===1) {
513 					if (parent) {
514 						parent.appendChild(el);
515 					}
516 				}
517 			}
518 			return el;
519 		}
520 		options = options || {};
521 		el = document.createElement(options.type || "div");
522 		parent = parent || options.parent;
523 		if (options.insertBefore && options.insertBefore.constructor===self.NodeSelection) {
524 			options.insertBefore = options.insertBefore._nodes[0];
525 		}
526 		if (!parent && options.insertBefore) {
527 			parent = options.insertBefore.parentNode;
528 		}
529 		for (x in options) {
530 			if (self.hasOwnProp(options, x)) {
531 				if ((x+"").substring(0,2).toLowerCase()==="on") {
532 					self.addEvent(el, x.substring(2), options[x]);
533 				}
534 				else if (x==="css" || x==="cssText") {
535 					if (vendorCssPrefix) {
536 						options[x] = options[x].replace(priv.regex.css3AutoPrefix, '$1'+vendorCssPrefix+'-$2:$3; $2:$3;');
537 						options[x] = options[x].replace(priv.regex.css3VendorPrefix, '-'+vendorCssPrefix+'-');
538 						el.style.cssText = options[x];
539 					}
540 					else {
541 						el.style.cssText = options[x];
542 					}
543 				}
544 				else if (x==='html' || x==='innerHTML') {
545 					self.setInnerHTML(el, options[x]);
546 				}
547 				else if (x==="attributes") {
548 					for (i in options[x]) {
549 						if (self.hasOwnProp(options[x], i)) {
550 							el.setAttribute(i, options[x][i]);
551 						}
552 					}
553 				}
554 				else if (x!=='parent' && x!=='children' && x!=='insertBefore' && x!=='type' && x!=='children' && x!=='html' && x!=='innerHTML') {
555 					if (document.all) {
556 						try {
557 							el[x] = options[x];
558 						}catch(err){
559 							self.log(x);
560 						}
561 					}
562 					else {
563 						el[x] = options[x];
564 					}
565 				}
566 				else {
567 					//self.log('Skipping "'+x+'" property in create()', options[x]);
568 				}
569 			}
570 		}
571 		if (parent) {
572 			if (options.insertBefore) {
573 				try {
574 					parent.insertBefore(el, options.insertBefore);
575 					insertedBefore = true;
576 				}catch(err) {
577 					insertedBefore = false;
578 				}
579 			}
580 			if (!insertedBefore) {
581 				parent.appendChild(el);
582 			}
583 		}
584 		
585 		if (options.children && self.isArray(options.children)) {
586 			childFrag = document.createDocumentFragment();
587 			for (x=0; x<options.children.length; x++) {
588 				self.createElement(options.children[x], childFrag);
589 			}
590 			el.appendChild(childFrag);
591 		}
592 		return el;
593 	};

596 	/**	Creates a new selection containing the elements of <code>nodes</code>. <br />
597 	 *	This class is not generally instantiated directly - instead, use the puredom() 
598 	 *	function to query for elements or wrap an Array of elements with a selection.
599 	 *	@class Represents a collection of DOM Elements. <br />
600 	 *	Puredom methods that work with DOM elements generally return an instance of this.
601 	 *	@name puredom.NodeSelection
602 	 *	@param {Array} nodes		An array of raw DOM nodes to wrap in a selection.
603 	 */
604 	self.NodeSelection = function NodeSelection(nodes) {
605 		var x;
606 		this._results = [];
607 		this._animations = [];
608 		if (nodes) {
609 			if (self.isArray(nodes)) {
610 				this._nodes = nodes = nodes.slice();
611 				for (x=nodes.length; x--; ) {
612 					if (!nodes[x]) {
613 						nodes.splice(x, 1);
614 					}
615 					else if (nodes[x] instanceof NodeSelection) {
616 						nodes = nodes.concat(nodes.splice(x, 1)[0]._nodes);
617 					}
618 				}
619 			}
620 			else {
621 				this._nodes = [nodes];
622 			}
623 		}
624 		else {
625 			this._nodes = [];
626 		}
627 	};
628 
629 	self.extend(self.NodeSelection.prototype, /** @lends puredom.NodeSelection# */ {
630 		
631 		/**	@private */
632 		_results : [],
633 		
634 		/**	@private */
635 		_nodes : [],
636 		
637 		/**	@private */
638 		_animations : [],
639 		
640 		
641 		/**	Get an Array of String representations of each element in the selection. <br />
642 		 *	For a more logging-friendly option, see {@link puredom.NodeSelection#describe}.
643 		 */
644 		describe : function() {
645 			var p = [];
646 			this.each(function(node) {
647 				var str = '<' + node.nodeName(),
648 					id = node.prop('id'),
649 					className = node.prop('className'),
650 					cn, i, g;
651 				if (id) {
652 					str += ' id="' + id + '"';
653 				}
654 				if (className) {
655 					str += ' class="' + className + '"';
656 				}
657 				str += '>';
658 				if (node._nodes[0].childNodes.length===1 && node._nodes[0].childNodes[0].nodeType===3) {
659 					str += node.text().replace(/(\r|\n)/gim,decodeURIComponent("%E2%86%A9")).replace(/\t/gim,decodeURIComponent("%E2%86%92"));
660 				}
661 				else {
662 					str += '[' + node.children().count() + ' children]';
663 				}
664 				str += '</' + node.nodeName() + '>';
665 				p.push(str);
666 			});
667 			return p;
668 		},
669 		
670 		/**	Get a String representation of the selection's current contents. <br />
671 		 *	For the raw Array description, see {@link puredom.NodeSelection#describe}.
672 		 */
673 		toString : function() {
674 			return this.describe().join(', ');
675 		},
676 		
677 		/**	@private */
678 		toSource : function() {
679 			return this._nodes;
680 		},
681 		
682 		/**	Get the result of the previous operation. <br />
683 		 *	Many puredom methods return the selection they were called on rather than a standard return value.
684 		 *	This method gets the equivalent return value of the most recent selection method call.
685 		 *	@param {Number} [reverseIndex=0]		Optionally get an older return value. This value is a 0-based offset.
686 		 *	@returns {Any} returnValue, or <code>undefined</code> if no value was returned.
687 		 */
688 		getResult : function(reverseIndex) {
689 			reverseIndex = Math.round(reverseIndex) || 0;
690 			return this._results[this._results.length - reverseIndex - 1];
691 		},
692 		
693 		/**	@private */
694 		pushResult : function(result) {
695 			this._results.push(result);
696 			return this;
697 		},
698 		
699 		/**	Call an iterator function on each element in the selection, wrapping each in a new {@link puredom.NodeSelection}.<br />
700 		 *	<strong>Note:</strong> Return <code>false</code> from within <code>iterator</code> to break out of the loop.
701 		 *	@param {Function} iterator	Gets passed <code>(element, index)</code> for each element in the selection. The value of <code>this</code> is the selection itself.
702 		 *	@returns {this}
703 		 */
704 		each : function(action) {
705 			return this._each(action, true);
706 		},
707 		
708 		/**	Call an iterator function on each <strong>raw DOM node</strong> in the selection.<br />
709 		 *	<strong>Note:</strong> Return <code>false</code> from within <code>iterator</code> to break out of the loop.
710 		 *	@param {Function} iterator	Gets passed <code>(node, index)</code> for each element in the selection. The value of <code>this</code> is the selection itself.
711 		 *	@returns {this}
712 		 */
713 		_each : function(action, asSelection, inReverse) {
714 			var nodes = this._nodes.slice(0,this._nodes.length),
715 				x, y, node, ret;
716 			for (x=0; x<nodes.length; x++) {
717 				y = x;
718 				if (inReverse===true) {
719 					y = nodes.length-y-1;
720 				}
721 				node = nodes[y];
722 				if (asSelection===true) {
723 					node = new self.NodeSelection(node);
724 				}
725 				ret = action.call(this, node, y);
726 				if (ret===false) {
727 					break;
728 				}
729 			}
730 			return this;
731 		},
732 		
733 		/**	Call a function on the selection in the future.
734 		 *	@param {Number} millis		The number of milliseconds to wait before calling <code>callback</code>.
735 		 *	@param {Function} callback	The function to call in <code>millis</code> milliseconds. Gets called on the selection, so the value of <code>this</code> is the selection itself.
736 		 *	@returns {this}
737 		 */
738 		wait : function(millis, callback) {
739 			var self = this;
740 			if (callback) {
741 				setTimeout(function() {
742 					callback.apply(self);
743 					self = callback = null;
744 				}, Math.abs(millis));
745 			}
746 			return this;
747 		},
748 		
749 		/**	Get the <strong>lower-case</strong> nodeName of an element.<br />
750 		 *	<em><strong>Note:</strong> Only returns a UUID for the first element in a selection.</em> <br />
751 		 *	<strong>Note:</strong> In puredom, the <code>window</code> Object is given a nodeName of "#window".
752 		 *	@returns {String} nodeName
753 		 */
754 		nodeName : function() {
755 			var node = this._nodes[0],
756 				nodeName = node && node.nodeName && node.nodeName.toLowerCase();
757 			if (node===window) {
758 				return '#window';
759 			}
760 			else if (nodeName) {
761 				return nodeName;
762 			}
763 			return null;
764 		},
765 		
766 		/**	Get a globally unique identifier for an element. <br />
767 		 *	<em><strong>Note:</strong> Only returns a UUID for the first element in a selection.</em>
768 		 *	@returns {String} uuid
769 		 */
770 		uuid : function() {
771 			return this._nodes[0] && priv.nodeToId(this._nodes[0]) || null;
772 		},
773 		
774 		/**	Get or set the textual content of elements. Omit <code>text</code> to retrieve the textual value instead of setting it.
775 		 *	@param {String} [text]		If set, replaces the textual content of elements.
776 		 *	@returns {String} text		The textual contents of the first element in the selection, or the selection itself if <code>text</code> was not set.
777 		 */
778 		text : function(text) {
779 			if (arguments.length===0) {
780 				return this._nodes[0] && this._nodes[0][textContentProperty || getSupportedTextContentProperty()] || '';
781 			}
782 			text = text + "";
783 			this._each(function(el) {
784 				el[textContentProperty || getSupportedTextContentProperty()] = text;
785 			});
786 			return this;
787 		},
788 		
789 		/**	Set the HTML contents of elements.
790 		 *	@param {String} [content]			If set, updates the content of the elements. If not set, returns the HTML content of the first element.
791 		 *	@param {Boolean} [asText=auto]		If <code>true</code>, content will be treated as textual, if <code>false</code> content will be treated as HTML. Defaults to auto-detection of HTML.
792 		 *	@returns {String} text		The HTML or textual contents of the first element in the selection, or the selection itself if <code>html</code> was not set.
793 		 */
794 		html : function(content, asText) {
795 			if (arguments.length===0) {
796 				return this._nodes[0] && this._nodes[0].innerHTML || '';
797 			}
798 			content = content + "";
799 			priv.regex.autoDetectHTMLContent.lastIndex = 0;
800 			if ((priv.regex.autoDetectHTMLContent).test(content) && asText!==true) {
801 				//self.log("Detected HTML in .html() insertion, using innerHTML...", {content:content});
802 				//alert('setting HTML: ' + content);
803 				this._each(function(el) {
804 					self.setInnerHTML(el, content);
805 				});
806 			}
807 			else {
808 				//alert('setting PLAIN: ' + content);
809 				//self.log("Detected plain text in .html() insertion, using textContent or equivalent...", {content:content});
810 				this._each(function(el) {
811 					el[textContentProperty || getSupportedTextContentProperty()] = content;
812 				});
813 			}
814 			return this;
815 		},
816 		
817 		/**	Apply CSS to elements.
818 		 *	@param {String|Object} css				CSS to apply to the elements in the selection. Either a CSS-string, or an Object where the keys are CSS properties and the values are the corresponding values to apply.
819 		 *	@param {Object} [options]				Options
820 		 *	@param {Number|String} [options.tween]	Animate the application of the given CSS styles. Numeric values are treated as durations, String values must be a comma-separated value of the format: "duration,easing-method".
821 		 *	@param {Function} [options.callback]	A function to call once the styles have been applied. If tweening/animating, gets called once the animation has completed.
822 		 *	@param {Function} callback				Same as <code>options.callback</code>, takes precidence when used.
823 		 *	@returns {this}
824 		 */
825 		css : function(css, options, callback) {
826 			var type,
827 				selection = this;
828 			options = options || {};
829 			if (typeof options==='string' || typeof options==='number') {
830 				options = {tween:options};
831 			}
832 			if (!callback && options.callback) {
833 				callback = options.callback;
834 			}
835 			if (!callback || !callback.call) {
836 				callback = priv.noop;
837 			}
838 			type = self.typeOf(options.tween);
839 			if (typeof css==='string') {
840 				css = priv.parseCSS(css);
841 			}
842 			if ((type==='string' && options.tween!=='none') || (type==='number' && options.tween>0)) {
843 				var tween = (options.tween + '').replace(priv.regex.whitespaceCharacters,'').split(','),
844 					x,
845 					cb,
846 					total = 0,
847 					completed = 0;
848 				cb = function(node) {
849 					completed += 1;
850 					if (completed>=total) {
851 						cb = null;
852 						if (callback) {
853 							callback.call(selection, selection);		// node
854 						}
855 						selection = callback = node = null;
856 					}
857 				};
858 				for (x in css) {
859 					if (css.hasOwnProperty(x)) {
860 						total += 1;
861 						this.animateCss(x, css[x], tween[0], tween[1], cb);
862 					}
863 				}
864 			}
865 			else {
866 				this._each(function(el) {
867 					self.applyCss(el, css);
868 				});
869 				
870 				if (callback) {
871 					setTimeout(function(){
872 						callback.call(selection, selection);
873 						selection = callback = null;
874 					}, 1);
875 				}
876 				else {
877 					selection = null;
878 				}
879 			}
880 			return this;
881 		},
882 		
883 		/** Show elements.
884 		 *	@returns {this}
885 		 */
886 		show : function() {
887 			this.css({
888 				display		: '',
889 				visibility	: 'visible'
890 			});
891 			// ensure the new active style is not display:none
892 			this._each(function(node) {
893 				if (node.style.display==='none' || self.nodeStyle(node, 'display')==='none') {
894 					node.style.display = 'block';
895 				}
896 			});
897 			return this;
898 		},
899 		
900 		/** Hide elements.
901 		 *	@param {Boolean} [andIgnore=true]		If <code>false</code>, triggers "visibility:hidden" CSS, instead of "display:none".
902 		 *	@returns {this}
903 		 */
904 		hide : function(andIgnore) {
905 			/*
906 			var disp = this.getStyle('display',true);
907 			if (disp && disp!=='none') {
908 				this._previousDisplayStyle = disp;
909 			}
910 			*/
911 			return this.css(
912 				andIgnore===false ? {visibility:'hidden'} : {display:'none'}
913 			);
914 		},
915 		
916 		/**	This function tries quite hard to guess what particular fade effect is needed. <br />
917 		 *	If the element that is already semi-transparent, it fades from the current opacity. <br />
918 		 *	If the element that is hidden but not explicitly transparent, it fades from opacity=0 (hidden). <br />
919 		 *	If the element is already 100% opaque (non-transparent), no animation is performed, and the callback is fired after a very small delay (to enforce async). <br />
920 		 *	Arguments are interchangeable for backward compatibility.
921 		 *	@param {Number|String} tween	A tween value. Can be a <code>{Number} duration</code>, or <code>{String} "duration,easing-method"</code>.
922 		 *	@param {Function} [callback]	A function to call once the fade has completed. Gets passed the selection.
923 		 *	@returns {this}
924 		 */
925 		fadeIn : function(tween, callback) {
926 			var originalOpacity = parseFloat(this.getStyle('opacity') || '0') || 0,
927 				targetOpacity = 1;
928 			if (this.getStyle('display')==='none' || this.getStyle('visibility')==='hidden') {
929 				if (this.getStyle('opacity') && originalOpacity>0 && originalOpacity<1) {
930 					targetOpacity = originalOpacity;
931 				}
932 				originalOpacity = 0;
933 				this.css({
934 					opacity : 0
935 				});
936 			}
937 			// arguments can be in reverse order
938 			if (self.typeOf(tween)==='function') {
939 				callback = tween;
940 				tween = arguments[1];
941 			}
942 			if (originalOpacity>=1 || tween===0 || tween===false) {
943 				this.css({
944 					opacity : targetOpacity
945 				}).show();
946 				if (callback && callback.call) {
947 					setTimeout(callback, 0);
948 				}
949 				return this;
950 			}
951 			this.css({
952 				opacity : targetOpacity
953 			}, {tween:tween || 'medium', callback:function(selection) {
954 				if (callback) {
955 					callback(selection);
956 				}
957 				tween = callback = null;
958 			}}).show();
959 			return this;
960 		},
961 		
962 		/**	The opposite of fadeIn(). Makes several guesses about the desired effect. */
963 		fadeOut : function(tween, callback, andIgnore) {
964 			var originalOpacity = parseFloat(this.getStyle('opacity') || '1') || 1;
965 			if (self.typeOf(tween)==='function') {
966 				callback = tween;
967 				tween = arguments[1];
968 			}
969 			if (self.typeOf(callback)==='boolean') {
970 				andIgnore = callback;
971 				callback = null;
972 				if (self.typeOf(arguments[2])==='function') {
973 					callback = arguments[2];
974 				}
975 			}
976 			if (originalOpacity<=0 || this.getStyle('display')==='none' || this.getStyle('visibility')==='hidden' || tween===0 || tween===false) {
977 				this.css({
978 					opacity : 0
979 				}).hide(andIgnore);
980 				setTimeout(callback, 0);
981 				return this;
982 			}
983 			this.css({
984 				opacity : 0
985 			}, {tween:tween || 'medium', callback:function(selection) {
986 				selection.hide(andIgnore).css({
987 					opacity : originalOpacity
988 				});
989 				if (callback) {
990 					callback(selection);
991 				}
992 				tween = callback = null;
993 			}});
994 			return this;
995 		},
996 		
997 		/**	Automatically detects and uses CSS3 transitions.
998 		 *	@private
999 		 */
1000 		animateCSS : (function() {
1001 			var manual, cssTransition, supportsCssTransition, checkCssTransitionSupport;
1002 			
1003 			/**	@ignore */
1004 			manual = function(cssProp, targetValue, duration, easing, callback) {
1005 				var startValues = [],
1006 					perNodeProperties = [],
1007 					numericTargetValue, units, s;
1008 				
1009 				cssProp = cssProp.toLowerCase();
1010 				
1011 				if (targetValue!=='auto') {
1012 					numericTargetValue = parseFloat((targetValue + '').replace(priv.regex.getNumericCSSValue,'')) || 0;
1013 					s = self.typeOf(targetValue)==='string' && targetValue.match(priv.regex.getCSSValueUnits);
1014 					units = (s && s[0]) || 'px';
1015 					if (cssProp==='opacity') {
1016 						units = '';
1017 					}
1018 				}
1019 				else {
1020 					units = cssProp==='opacity' ? '' : 'px';
1021 				}
1022 				
1023 				this._each(function(node, i) {
1024 					var ts, tss, testCssObj={}, iprop, vis;
1025 					
1026 					startValues[i] = parseFloat((self.nodeStyle(node, cssProp) + '').replace(priv.regex.getNonIntegerCharsSigned,'')) || 0;
1027 					
1028 					if (targetValue==='auto' || targetValue==='') {
1029 						vis = node.style.visibility || '';
1030 						testCssObj[cssProp] = targetValue;
1031 						testCssObj.visibility = 'hidden';
1032 						self.applyCss(node, testCssObj);
1033 						ts = self.nodeStyle(node, cssProp);
1034 						if (ts===targetValue || ts.indexOf('px')<ts.length-3) {
1035 							iprop = cssProp.substring(0,1).toUpperCase() + cssProp.substring(1).toLowerCase();
1036 							ts = node['offset'+iprop] + 'px';
1037 						}
1038 						tss = self.typeOf(ts)==='string' && ts.match(priv.regex.getCSSValueUnits);
1039 						perNodeProperties[i] = {
1040 							_actualTarget : targetValue,
1041 							numericTargetValue : parseFloat((ts + '').replace(priv.regex.getNumericCSSValue,'')) || 0,
1042 							units : cssProp==='opacity' ? '' : (tss && tss[0] || 'px')
1043 						};
1044 						setTimeout(function() {
1045 							node.style.visibility = vis;
1046 							node = null;
1047 						}, 51);
1048 						testCssObj = ts = tss = null;
1049 					}
1050 					else {
1051 						perNodeProperties[i] = {
1052 							numericTargetValue : numericTargetValue,
1053 							units : units
1054 						};
1055 					}
1056 				});
1057 				
1058 				return this.animate(function(fraction, anim) {
1059 					this._each(function(node, i) {
1060 						var cssObj = {},
1061 							value = (fraction * (perNodeProperties[i].numericTargetValue-startValues[i]) + startValues[i]),
1062 							floatVal,
1063 							units = perNodeProperties[i].units;
1064 						if (units==='px') {
1065 							value = Math.round(value);
1066 						}
1067 						else {
1068 							floatVal = parseFloat(value);
1069 							if (floatVal%1===0) {
1070 								value = Math.round(floatVal);
1071 							}
1072 							else {
1073 								value = floatVal.toFixed(2);
1074 							}
1075 						}
1076 						cssObj[cssProp] = value + units;
1077 						self.applyCss(node, cssObj);
1078 					});
1079 				}, duration, easing, function(sel) {
1080 					sel._each(function(node, i) {
1081 						var cssObj = {};
1082 						if (perNodeProperties[i]._actualTarget) {
1083 							cssObj[cssProp] = perNodeProperties[i]._actualTarget;
1084 							self.applyCss(node, cssObj);
1085 						}
1086 					});
1087 					callback.apply(sel, arguments);
1088 				});
1089 			};
1090 			
1091 			/**	@ignore */
1092 			cssTransition = function(cssProp, targetValue, duration, easing, callback) {
1093 				var anim = this._createAnimationObj(function(){}, duration, easing, callback),
1094 					me = this,
1095 					transition = {},
1096 					css = {};
1097 				
1098 				cssProp = self.getStyleAsProperty(cssProp);
1099 				if (self.typeOf(targetValue)==='number' && (cssProp+'').toLowerCase()!=='opacity') {
1100 					targetValue = targetValue + 'px';
1101 				}
1102 				
1103 				transition[self.getStyleAsCSS(cssProp)] = {
1104 					duration : anim.duration,
1105 					timingFunction : anim.easing
1106 				};
1107 				
1108 				css[cssProp] = targetValue;
1109 				
1110 				setTimeout(function() {
1111 					/**	@ignore */
1112 					me._each(function(node) {
1113 						self.updateCssTransitions(node, transition);
1114 						self.applyCss(node, css);
1115 						priv.incrementAnimationCount(node);
1116 					});
1117 					/**	@ignore */
1118 					anim._cb = function() {
1119 						if (anim) {
1120 							
1121 							/** remove CSS transition definitions from the generated CSS:
1122 							 *	@ignore
1123 							 */
1124 							var nullTransition = {};
1125 							nullTransition[cssProp] = null;
1126 							me._each(function(node) {
1127 								self.updateCssTransitions(node, nullTransition);
1128 								priv.decrementAnimationCount(node);
1129 							});
1130 							
1131 							if (anim.callback) {
1132 								anim.callback.call(me, me);
1133 							}
1134 							for (var x in anim) {
1135 								if (anim.hasOwnProperty(x)) {
1136 									try{ delete anim[x]; }catch(err){}
1137 								}
1138 							}
1139 						}
1140 						anim = css = callback = me = null;
1141 					};
1142 					setTimeout(anim._cb, (parseInt(anim.duration,10) || 0)+20);
1143 				}, 10);
1144 			};
1145 			
1146 			/**	@ignore */
1147 			checkCssTransitionSupport = function() {
1148 				supportsCssTransition = document.body.style[vendorCssPrefixJS+'Transition']!==undefined || document.body.style.transition!==undefined;
1149 				return supportsCssTransition;
1150 			};
1151 			
1152 			return function(cssProp, targetValue, duration, easing, callback) {
1153 				var iosCompat=false, x;
1154 				if (self.typeOf(supportsCssTransition)!=='boolean') {
1155 					checkCssTransitionSupport();
1156 				}
1157 				if ((self.allowCssTransitions!==false || iosCompat===true) && supportsCssTransition) {
1158 					cssTransition.apply(this, arguments);
1159 				}
1160 				else {
1161 					manual.apply(this, arguments);
1162 				}
1163 				return this;
1164 			};
1165 		}()),

1167 		animate : function(animator, duration, easing, callback) {
1168 			if (animator) {
1169 				var nodeSelection = this,
1170 					anim = this._createAnimationObj.apply(this, arguments),
1171 					frame;
1172 				
1173 				this._each(function(node) {
1174 					priv.incrementAnimationCount(node);
1175 				});
1176 				
1177 				frame = function(now) {
1178 					anim.frameTime = now;
1179 					anim.position = anim.frameTime - anim.start;
1180 					anim.fraction = anim.position / anim.duration;
1181 					if (anim.position>=anim.duration) {
1182 						anim.fraction = 1;
1183 						anim.position = anim.duration;
1184 					}
1185 					else if (anim.easingMethod) {
1186 						anim.fraction = anim.easingMethod.call(self.easingMethods, anim.fraction, anim);
1187 					}
1188 					
1189 					anim.animator.call(nodeSelection, anim.fraction, anim);
1190 					
1191 					if (anim.fraction===1) {
1192 						for (var x=nodeSelection._animations.length; x--; ) {
1193 							if (nodeSelection._animations[x]===anim) {
1194 								nodeSelection._animations.splice(x, 1);
1195 								break;
1196 							}
1197 						}
1198 						if (anim.callback) {
1199 							setTimeout(function() {
1200 								nodeSelection._each(function(node) {
1201 									priv.decrementAnimationCount(node);
1202 								});
1203 								anim.callback.call(nodeSelection, nodeSelection, anim);
1204 								nodeSelection = anim = null;
1205 							}, 10);
1206 						}
1207 					}
1208 					else {
1209 						anim.timer = self.animationFrame.getTimer(frame, self.baseAnimationInterval || 10);
1210 					}
1211 				};
1212 				
1213 				self.animationFrame.getTimer(frame, self.baseAnimationInterval || 10);
1214 				
1215 				this._animations.push(anim);
1216 			}
1217 			return this;
1218 		},

1220 		/**	@private */
1221 		_createAnimationObj : function(animator, duration, easing, callback) {
1222 			var anim = {
1223 				animator	: animator,
1224 				duration	: duration,
1225 				easing		: self.typeOf(easing)==='string' ? easing : 'ease',
1226 				callback	: callback,
1227 				start		: self.animationFrame.getStartTime(),
1228 				frameTime	: null
1229 			};
1230 			
1231 			if (self.typeOf(anim.duration)==='string') {
1232 				switch (anim.duration.toLowerCase()) {
1233 					case 'long':
1234 					case 'slow':
1235 						anim.duration = priv.animationTimes.slow;
1236 						break;
1237 					case 'short':
1238 					case 'fast':
1239 						anim.duration = priv.animationTimes.fast;
1240 						break;
1241 					default:
1242 						anim.duration = parseInt(anim.duration, 10) || priv.animationTimes.medium;
1243 				}
1244 			}
1245 			else {
1246 				anim.duration = Math.round(anim.duration) || priv.animationTimes.medium;
1247 			}
1248 			
1249 			if (priv.animationTimeScale) {
1250 				anim.duration *= priv.animationTimeScale;
1251 			}
1252 			
1253 			if (anim.easing && self.easingMethods.hasOwnProperty(anim.easing)) {
1254 				anim.easingMethod = self.easingMethods[anim.easing];
1255 			}
1256 			else {
1257 				anim.easing = null;
1258 			}
1259 			return anim;
1260 		},

1729 		
1730 		/**	@private */
1731 		_removeAllEvents : function(deep) {
1732 			var children;
1733 			this._each(function(node) {
1734 				priv.wrappedEventListener.destroyObjHandlers(node, true);
1735 			});
1736 			children = this.children();
1737 			if (deep===true && children.count()>0) {
1738 				children._removeAllEvents(true);
1739 			}
1740 			children = deep = null;
1741 			return this;
1742 		},
1743 
1744 		/**	Append an element to the DOM.
1745 		 *	@param {puredom.NodeSelection|HTMLElement} child	An element or a Selection of elements to append
1746 		 *	@returns {this}
1747 		 */
1748 		appendChild : function(child) {
1749 			if (child && this._nodes.length>0) {
1750 				if (child.constructor===this.constructor) {
1751 					var parent = this._nodes[0];
1752 					child._each(function(node) {
1753 						parent.appendChild(node);
1754 					});
1755 				}
1756 				else {
1757 					this._nodes[0].appendChild(child);
1758 				}
1759 			}
1760 			return this;
1761 		},
1762 
1763 		/**	Insert an element into the DOM before a given reference element.
1764 		 *	@param {puredom.NodeSelection|HTMLElement} child	An element or a Selection of elements to insert
1765 		 *	@param {puredom.NodeSelection|HTMLElement} before	An element or a Selection to insert <code>child</code> before
1766 		 *	@returns {this}
1767 		 */
1768 		insertBefore : function(child, before) {
1769 			if (child && this._nodes.length>0) {
1770 				if (before && before.constructor===this.constructor) {
1771 					before = before._nodes[0];
1772 				}
1773 				if (!before || before.parentNode!==this._nodes[0]) {
1774 					return this.appendChild(child);
1775 				}
1776 				if (child.constructor===this.constructor) {
1777 					var parent = this._nodes[0];
1778 					child._each(function(node) {
1779 						parent.insertBefore(node, before);
1780 					}, null, true);
1781 				}
1782 				else {
1783 					this._nodes[0].insertBefore(child, before);
1784 				}
1785 			}
1786 			return this;
1787 		},
1788 
1789 		/**	Insert all elements in the Selection into a given parent. <br />
1790 		 *	Uses document fragments to improve performance when inserting a Selection containing multiple nodes.
1791 		 *	@param {puredom.NodeSelection|HTMLElement} what		A parent into which the selection should be inserted
1792 		 *	@returns {this}
1793 		 */
1794 		insertInto : function(what) {
1795 			var frag;
1796 			if (what && this.count()>0) {
1797 				if (what.constructor===this.constructor) {
1798 					what = what._nodes[0];
1799 				}
1800 				if (this.count()===1) {
1801 					what.appendChild(this._nodes[0]);
1802 				}
1803 				else {
1804 					// TODO: Why was this added for IE? Was this a bug?
1805 					//frag = priv.support.filters===true ? what : document.createDocumentFragment();
1806 					frag = document.createDocumentFragment();
1807 					this._each(function(node) {
1808 						frag.appendChild(node);
1809 					}, null, true);							// reverse
1810 					if (priv.support.filters!==true) {
1811 						what.appendChild(frag);
1812 					}
1813 				}
1814 			}
1815 			return this;
1816 		},

1818 		/**	Remove all elements in the Selection from the DOM.
1819 		 *	@returns {this}
1820 		 */
1821 		remove : function() {
1822 			this.fireEvent('remove');
1823 			this._each(function(node) {
1824 				if (node.parentNode) {
1825 					node.parentNode.removeChild(node);
1826 				}
1827 			});
1828 			return this;
1829 		},

1831 		/**	Remove all elements in the Selection from the DOM, and <strong>destroy them</strong>. <br />
1832 		 *	<strong>Note:</strong> This also removes all elements from the Selection.
1833 		 *	@returns {this}
1834 		 */
1835 		destroy : function() {
1836 			this.remove();
1837 			this.fireEvent('destroy');
1838 			this._removeAllEvents(true);
1839 			this._nodes.splice(0, this._nodes.length);
1840 			return this;
1841 		},

1843 		/**	Search for elements within the Selection's tree that match the given CSS selector. <br />
1844 		 *	<strong>Note:</strong> This is a scoped version of puredom(selector).
1845 		 *	@param {String} selector	A CSS selector
1846 		 *	@param {Object} [options]	Options, which get passed to puredom()
1847 		 *	@returns {puredom.NodeSelection} results
1848 		 */
1849 		query : function(selector, options) {
1850 			var results = [];
1851 			if (this._nodes.length>0) {
1852 				options = puredom.extend({}, options || {});
1853 				this._each(function(node) {
1854 					var r;
1855 					options.within = node;
1856 					r = self.getElement(selector, options);
1857 					if (self.isArray(r) && r.length>0) {
1858 						results = results.concat(r);
1859 					}
1860 				});
1861 			}
1862 			return new self.NodeSelection(results);
1863 		},
1864 
1865 		/**	Clone the selection, optionally into a new parent node.
1866 		 *	@param {Boolean} [deep=true]	Perform a deep clone, which clones all descendent nodes.
1867 		 *	@param {Object} [newParent]		Optionally inject into a new parentNode. Pass <code>true</code> to clone into the same parent.
1868 		 *	@returns {puredom.NodeSelection} clonedSelection
1869 		 */
1870 		clone : function(deep, newParent) {
1871 			var sel = [];
1872 			if (newParent===true) {
1873 				newParent = this.parent();
1874 			}
1875 			this._each(function(node) {
1876 				sel.push( node.cloneNode(deep!==false) );
1877 			});
1878 			sel = new self.NodeSelection(sel);
1879 			if (newParent) {
1880 				newParent.appendChild(sel);
1881 			}
1882 			sel._each(priv.removeNodeUID);
1883 			if (deep!==false) {
1884 				sel.query('*')._each(priv.removeNodeUID);
1885 			}
1886 			return sel;
1887 		},

1903 		/**	Get a new Selection containing both the next and previous sibling elements of each element in the current Selection.
1904 		 *	@returns {puredom.NodeSelection} siblings
1905 		 */
1906 		siblings : function() {
1907 			var newSelection = new self.NodeSelection();
1908 			this._each(function(node) {
1909 				var n = node;
1910 				while ((n=n.previousSibling)) {
1911 					if (n.nodeName!=='#text' && n.nodeName!=='#comment' && n.nodeType!==3) {
1912 						newSelection._nodes.push(n);
1913 					}
1914 				}
1915 				n = node;
1916 				while ((n=n.nextSibling)) {
1917 					if (n.nodeName!=='#text' && n.nodeName!=='#comment' && n.nodeType!==3) {
1918 						newSelection._nodes.push(n);
1919 					}
1920 				}
1921 			});
1922 			return newSelection;
1923 		},

1925 		/**	Get a new Selection containing the next sibling elements of each element in the current Selection.
1926 		 *	@returns {puredom.NodeSelection} nextSiblings
1927 		 */

1930 			while (sib && sib.nodeType===3) {
1931 				sib = sib.nextSibling;
1932 			}
1933 			return new self.NodeSelection(sib && [sib] || null);
1934 		},

1997 		/**	Get a new Selection containing the de-duped parent elements of the current Selection.
1998 		 *	@returns {puredom.NodeSelection} parents
1999 		 */
2000 		parent : function() {
2001 			var nodes=[], parent;
2002 			this._each(function(node) {
2003 				parent = node.parentNode;
2004 				// Note: all newly created elements are placed into a document fragment in IE. 
2005 				// Unfortunately, this means parentNodes that are #document-fragment's can't be considered valid (lowest-common).
2006 				if (parent && nodes.indexOf(parent)<0 && parent.nodeType!==11) {
2007 					nodes.push(parent);
2008 				}
2009 			});
2010 			return new self.NodeSelection(nodes);
2011 		},

2013 		/**	Get a new Selection containing all direct child elements of the current Selection.
2014 		 *	@returns {puredom.NodeSelection} children
2015 		 */
2016 		children : function() {
2017 			var children = [], 
2018 				x, y;
2019 			if (this._nodes.length>0) {
2020 				for (x=0; x<this._nodes.length; x++) {
2021 					if (this._nodes[x].childNodes) {
2022 						for (y=0; y<this._nodes[x].childNodes.length; y++) {
2023 							if (this._nodes[x].childNodes[y].nodeType!==3 && this._nodes[x].childNodes[y].nodeName!=='#text' && this._nodes[x].childNodes[y].nodeName!=='#comment') {
2024 								children.push(this._nodes[x].childNodes[y]);
2025 							}
2026 						}
2027 					}
2028 				}
2029 			}
2030 			return new self.NodeSelection(children);
2031 		},

2033 		/**	Submit any forms in the Selection.
2034 		 *	@returns {this}
2035 		 */
2036 		submit : function() {
2037 			return this._each(function(node) {
2038 				var evt = self.fireEvent({
2039 					type : 'submit',
2040 					target : node
2041 				});
2042 				if (evt.rval!==false && evt.returnValue!==false && evt.preventDefault!==true) {
2043 					if (node.submit) {
2044 						node.submit();
2045 					}
2046 				}
2047 			});
2048 		},
2049 
2050 		/** Get or set the selected text of an input element. <br />
2051 		 *	<strong>Note:</strong> This only operates on the first element in the selection.
2052 		 *	@param {Number} start			A character index at which to start text selection
2053 		 *	@param {Number} [end=start]		A character index at which to end text selection
2054 		 *	@returns {Object} An object with <code>start</code>, <code>end</code> and <code>text</code> properties correspdonding to the current selection state.
2055 		 */
2056 		selection : function(start, end) {
2057 			var el = this._nodes[0],
2058 				value, sel, before, endMax, range;
2059 			if (start && typeof start!=='number' && start.start) {
2060 				end = start.end;
2061 				start = start.start;
2062 			}
2063 			if (typeof start==='number') {
2064 				if (start<0) {
2065 					start = 0;
2066 				}
2067 				endMax = el.value.length;
2068 				if (end>endMax) {
2069 					end = endMax;
2070 				}
2071 				if (start>end) {
2072 					start = end;
2073 				}
2074 				else if (end<start) {
2075 					end = start;
2076 				}
2077 				
2078 				if(window.getSelection) {
2079 					el.selectionStart = start;
2080 					el.selectionEnd = end;
2081 				}
2082 				else if (el.selectionEnd || el.selectionEnd===0) {
2083 					el.selectionStart = start;
2084 					el.selectionEnd = end;
2085 				}
2086 				else if (el.createTextRange) {
2087 					range = el.createTextRange();
2088 					range.collapse(true);
2089 					range.moveStart('character', start);
2090 					range.moveEnd('character', end);
2091 					range.select();
2092 				}
2093 			}
2094 			else {
2095 				if (window.getSelection) {					// Stanadards
2096 					value = typeof el.value==='string' ? el.value : el.innerHTML;
2097 					sel = window.getSelection();
2098 					return {
2099 						start	: el.selectionStart+0,
2100 						end		: el.selectionEnd+0,
2101 						text	: value.substring(sel.start, sel.end)
2102 					};
2103 				}
2104 				else if (document.selection) {				// IE
2105 					sel = document.selection.createRange();
2106 					before = document.body.createTextRange();
2107 					before.moveToElementText(el);
2108 					before.setEndPoint("EndToStart", sel);
2109 					return {
2110 						start	: before.text.length,
2111 						end		: before.text.length + sel.text.length,
2112 						text	: sel.text
2113 					};
2114 				}
2115 				else {
2116 					self.log("Selection retrieval is not supported in this browser.");
2117 					return {
2118 						start	: 0,
2119 						end		: 0,
2120 						text	: ''
2121 					};
2122 				}
2123 			}
2124 			return this;
2125 		},
2126 
2127 		/**	Template the Selection and all descendants based on <code>data-tpl-id</code> attributes. <br />
2128 		 *	Each element with a <code>data-tpl-id</code> attribute will have it's contents updated with the corresponding value of that attribute when interpreted as a dot-notated key path within <code>templateFields</code>. <br />
2129 		 *	<code>data-tpl-id</code> attribute values can optionally include a pipe-separated list of "filters". <br />
2130 		 *	<strong>Example:</strong> <br />
2131 		 *		<pre><span data-tpl-id="article.title|ucWords|truncate:byWord,300|htmlEntities"></span></pre> <br />
2132 		 *	<em><strong>Note:</strong> the "htmlEntities" filter is already added for you where needed.</em>
2133 		 *	@param {Object} [templateFields={}]		Template data fields. Nested Objects/Arrays are addressable via dot notation.
2134 		 *	@returns {this}
2135 		 */
2136 		template : function(templateFields) {
2137 			var attrName = self.templateAttributeName,
2138 				getFilters;
2139 			templateFields = templateFields || {};
2140 			
2141 			getFilters = function(value, htmlEntities) {
2142 				var filters = value.split('|'),
2143 					i;
2144 				value = filters.splice(0, 1)[0];
2145 				for (i=filters.length; i--; ) {
2146 					if (filters[i]==='htmlEntities') {
2147 						filters.splice(i, 1);
2148 					}
2149 				}
2150 				return filters;
2151 			};
2152 			
2153 			this.query('['+attrName+']').each(function(node) {
2154 				var nodeName = node.nodeName(),
2155 					tplField = node.attr(attrName),
2156 					tplValue = tplField,
2157 					tplFilters,
2158 					nType;
2159 				
2160 				tplFilters = getFilters(tplField);
2161 				tplField = tplField.split('|')[0];
2162 				
2163 				tplValue = puredom.delve(templateFields, tplField);
2164 				
2165 				if (tplValue!==null && tplValue!==undefined) {
2166 					if ((tplValue instanceof Date || tplValue.constructor.name==='Date') && tplValue.toLocaleString) {
2167 						tplValue = tplValue.toLocaleString();
2168 					}
2169 					nType = node.attr('data-tpl-prop');
2170 					if (nType) {
2171 						node.prop(nType, self.text.filter(tplValue, tplFilters.join('|')));
2172 					}
2173 					else {
2174 						switch (nodeName) {
2175 							case 'select':
2176 							case 'input':
2177 							case 'textarea':
2178 							case 'meter':
2179 							case 'progress':
2180 								node.value(tplValue);
2181 								break;
2182 							
2183 							case 'img':
2184 							case 'video':
2185 							case 'audio':
2186 							case 'iframe':
2187 								tplFilters.splice(0, 0, 'htmlEntities');
2188 								tplValue = self.text.filter(tplValue, tplFilters.join('|'));
2189 								node.attr('src', tplValue);
2190 								break;
2191 							
2192 							default:
2193 								tplFilters.splice(0, 0, 'htmlEntities');
2194 								tplValue = self.text.filter(tplValue, tplFilters.join('|'));
2195 								node.html(tplValue);
2196 								break;
2197 						}
2198 					}
2199 				}
2200 			});
2201 			templateFields = null;
2202 			return this;
2203 		}
2204 	});

2269 	/**	Create or retrieve one or more elements based on a query. <br />
2270 	 *	If query begins with "<" or is an object, a new element is contructed based on that information. <br />
2271 	 *	If the query is a CSS selector, DOM nodes matching that selector are returned.
2272 	 *	@param {String|Object} query	A CSS selector (retrieval), or a DOM description (creation).
2273 	 *	@param {Boolean} [log=false]	If true, query process will be logged to the console.
2274 	 *	@returns {puredom.NodeSelection} selection
2275 	 */
2276 	self.el = function(query, log) {
2277 		var results, type;
2278 		if (query) {
2279 			type = typeof query;
2280 			if (type==='string' && query.charAt(0)!=='<') {
2281 				if (log===true) {
2282 					self.log('query is a CSS selector', query, type);
2283 				}
2284 				if (query==='body') {
2285 					results = document.body;
2286 				}
2287 				else if (query==='html') {
2288 					results = document.documentElement || document;
2289 				}
2290 				else {
2291 					results = self.getElement(query, arguments[1]);
2292 				}
2293 			}
2294 			else if (self.isArray(query)) {
2295 				results = [];
2296 				for (var x=0; x<query.length; x++) {
2297 					Array.prototype.splice.apply(results, [0,0].concat(self.el(query[x])._nodes) );
2298 				}
2299 			}
2300 			else if (type==='string' || (type==='object' && !query.nodeName && query!==window)) {
2301 				if (log===true) {
2302 					self.log('query is an HTML fragment', query, type);
2303 				}
2304 				results = self.createElement.apply(self, arguments);
2305 			}
2306 			else if (query.constructor===self.NodeSelection) {
2307 				if (log===true) {
2308 					self.log('query is already a NodeSelection', query.constructor+'', query.constructor.name);
2309 				}
2310 				return query;
2311 			}
2312 			else if (query.nodeName || query===window) {
2313 				if (log===true) {
2314 					self.log('query is an HTML element', query, type);
2315 				}
2316 				if (query===window) {
2317 					query = document.documentElement || document;
2318 				}
2319 				results = query;
2320 			}
2321 		}
2322 		return new self.NodeSelection(results);
2323 	};
2324 	
2325 	
2326 	
2327 	/**	Get a selection ({@link puredom.NodeSelection}) containing the node with the given UUID. <br />
2328 	 *	UniqueIDs can be retrieved using {@link puredom.NodeSelection#uuid}.
2329 	 *	@param {String} uuid						Unique node ID, such as one derived from {@link puredom.NodeSelection#uuid}.
2330 	 *	@returns {puredom.NodeSelection} selection	A selection ({@link puredom.NodeSelection}) containing the referenced node.
2331 	 */
2332 	self.node = function(uuid) {
2333 		return new self.NodeSelection(priv.idToNode(uuid));
2334 	};

2338 	/** Returns an {Array} of elements matching the passed CSS selector query.

2341 	 *	@param {Object} [options]						Hashmap of one-time triggers for the engine (see detailed parameter listing)

2343 	 *	@param {Boolean} [options.logging=false]		Enable logging for this query
2344 	 *	@param {Boolean} [options.useCached=false]		Return a cached result if available
2345 	 *	@param {Boolean} [options.cache=false]			Cache the result
2346 	 *	@returns {Array(HTMLElement)}	An Array of matched HTML elements.
2347 	 */
2348 	self.getElement = (function() {
2349 		/**	@exports getElement as puredom.selectorEngine */

2352 			cache = {},

2414 				/**	@ignore */
2415 				filter : function(rawMatches, results, config) {
2416 					var i, matches, isMatch, attrValue, pos;
2417 					if (rawMatches && rawMatches[1]) {
2418 						matches = {
2419 							attribute : rawMatches[1]
2420 						};

2423 							matches.attrValue = rawMatches[4] || '';
2424 						}

2436 								if (matches.attrValue==='true' || matches.attrValue==='false') {

2438 								}
2439 								else {
2440 									attrValue = results[i].selected?'selected':null;
2441 								}

2447 							matches.attrSet = attrValue && attrValue.length>0;
2448 							if (matches.attrValue) {
2449 								pos = matches.attrPresent ? attrValue.indexOf(matches.attrValue) : -1;
2450 							}
2451 							switch (matches.type || '') {
2452 								case '=':
2453 									isMatch = attrValue===matches.attrValue;
2454 									break;
2455 								case '^=':
2456 									isMatch = pos===0;
2457 									break;
2458 								case '$=':

2460 									break;
2461 								case '~=':

2469 							if (!isMatch) {
2470 								results.splice(i, 1);
2471 							}
2472 						}
2473 					}
2474 				}
2475 			},
2476 			
2477 			/** > Descendant selector
2478 			 *	@tests:
2479 			 *			// Should return <head> and <body>:
2480 			 *		puredom.el(' > ');
2481 			 *			// Should log DIV > A a number of times, but nothing else:
2482 			 *		puredom.el('div > a').each(function(e){console.log(e.parent().prop('nodeName') + ' > ' + e.prop('nodeName'));});
2483 			 *			// Should log DIV > XXXXX:
2484 			 *		puredom.el('div > ').each(function(e){console.log(e.parent().prop('nodeName') + ' > ' + e.prop('nodeName'));});
2485 			 *	@ignore
2486 			 */
2487 			{

2490 				/**	@ignore */
2491 				filter : function(matches, results, config) {
2492 					var originalResults = [].concat(results),
2493 						nodeName = (matches[1] || '*').toLowerCase(),
2494 						x, i, children, childN;
2495 					results.splice(0, results.length);
2496 					// If the descendent selector is used first, use searchBaseNode as the parent
2497 					if (!config.isFiltered && config.first) {
2498 						// we're operating on the document root. That's fine, but it deserves a warning.
2499 						self.log('Descendant selector called on an unfiltered result set.  Operating on descendants of the document.');
2500 					}
2501 					if (!config.isFiltered || config.first) {
2502 						originalResults = [config.searchBaseNode];
2503 					}
2504 					for (x=0; x<originalResults.length; x++) {
2505 						children = originalResults[x].childNodes;
2506 						for (i=0; i<children.length; i++) {
2507 							childN = (children[i].nodeName + '').toLowerCase();
2508 							if (childN===nodeName || (nodeName==='*' && childN.charAt(0)!=='#' && (children[i].nodeType===1 || children[i].nodeType===9))) {
2509 								results.push(children[i]);
2510 							}
2511 						}
2512 					}
2513 				}
2514 			},
2515 			
2516 			/** :nth-child aliases, like :first-child
2517 			 *	@ignore
2518 			 */
2519 			{
2520 				title : 'nth-child aliases, like :first-child',
2521 				regex : /^\:(first|last|only)\-(child|of\-type)/gm,
2522 				/**	@ignore */
2523 				filter : function(matches, results, config) {
2524 					var map = {
2525 							'first-child'	: ':nth-child(0n+1)',
2526 							'first-of-type'	: ':nth-of-type(0n+1)',
2527 							'last-child'	: ':nth-last-child(0n+1)',
2528 							'last-of-type'	: ':nth-last-of-type(0n+1)'
2529 							// only-child can't really be done here, unless nth-child gets a bit more complex
2530 						},
2531 						i, selector, mappedSelector, submatches;
2532 					for (i=selectors.length; i--; ) {
2533 						if (selectors[i].isNthChildSelector===true) {
2534 							selector = selectors[i];
2535 							break;
2536 						}
2537 					}
2538 					
2539 					if (map.hasOwnProperty(matches[1]+'-'+matches[2]) && selector) {
2540 						mappedSelector = map[matches[1]+'-'+matches[2]];
2541 						selector.regex.lastIndex = 0;
2542 						submatches = selector.regex.exec(mappedSelector);
2543 						return selector.filter(submatches, results, config);
2544 					}
2545 					else {
2546 						self.log('Unknown nth-child alias "'+matches[1]+'-'+matches[2]+'"');
2547 					}
2548 				}
2549 			},
2550 			
2551 			/** :nth-child() selector
2552 			 *	@tests:
2553 			 *			// Should return third element in the body
2554 			 *		puredom.el(' :nth-child(n*2)');
2555 			 *	@ignore
2556 			 */
2557 			{
2558 				isNthChildSelector : true,
2559 				title : 'nth-child selector {:nth-child(n+2) & variants}',
2560 				regex : /^\:(nth(?:\-last)?(?:\-of\-type|\-child))\((?:(\-?[0-9]*n(?:[+-][0-9]+)?)|([0-9]+)|([a-z]+))\)/gm,
2561 				/**	@ignore */
2562 				filter : function(matches, results, config) {
2563 					var originalResults,
2564 						x, i, d, p, t,
2565 						type,
2566 						child, childIndex,
2567 						// for expr:
2568 						a, b, n,
2569 						ofType = matches[1].indexOf('-of-type')!==-1,
2570 						named = {
2571 							odd : [2,1],
2572 							even : [2]
2573 						};
2574 					
2575 					originalResults = results.splice(0, results.length);
2576 					
2577 					if (matches[1].indexOf('-last')!==-1) {
2578 						originalResults.reverse();
2579 					}
2580 					
2581 					if (matches[2]) {		// explicit an+b
2582 						p = matches[2].split('n');
2583 						if (p[0].replace('-','').length===0) {
2584 							p[0] = p[0] + '1';
2585 						}
2586 						a = Math.round(p[0].replace('+','')) || 0;
2587 						b = Math.round(p[1].replace('+','')) || 0;
2588 					}
2589 					else if (matches[3]) {	// (implied 1n) + b
2590 						a = 0;
2591 						b = Math.round(matches[3]) || 0;
2592 					}
2593 					else if (matches[4]) {	// named sets: odd, even
2594 						p = matches[4].toLowerCase();
2595 						if (named.hasOwnProperty(p)) {
2596 							a = named[p][0] || 0;
2597 							b = named[p][1] || 0;
2598 						}
2599 						else {
2600 							self.log('Unknown named nth-child expression "'+r[4]+'"');
2601 						}
2602 					}
2603 					
2604 					if (a+b<=0) {
2605 						return;
2606 					}
2607 					if (a===b) {
2608 						b = 0;
2609 					}
2610 					
2611 					
2612 					for (x=0; x<originalResults.length; x++) {
2613 						children = (originalResults[x].parentNode || {}).childNodes;
2614 						type = (originalResults[x].nodeName+'').toLowerCase();
2615 						isMatch = false;
2616 						if (children) {
2617 							childIndex = 0;
2618 							for (i=0; i<children.length; i++) {
2619 								child = children[i];
2620 								t = ofType ? (child.nodeName+'').toLowerCase()===type : ((child.nodeName+'').substring(0,1)!=='#' || child.nodeType===1 || child.nodeType===9);
2621 								if (t) {
2622 									childIndex += 1;
2623 									if (child===originalResults[x]) {
2624 										if (a>0) {
2625 											isMatch = (childIndex%a - b)===0;
2626 										}
2627 										else {
2628 											isMatch = childIndex === b;
2629 										}
2630 										if (isMatch) {
2631 											break;
2632 										}
2633 									}
2634 								}
2635 							}
2636 						}
2637 						if (isMatch) {
2638 							results.push(originalResults[x]);
2639 						}
2640 					}
2641 				}
2642 			},
2643 			
2644 			/** Nested element pseudo-pseudo-selector, with built-in nodeName filtering
2645 			 *	@ignore
2646 			 */
2647 			{
2648 				title : 'within_internal selector { }',
2649 				regex : /^\s+((?:[a-z][a-z0-9\:\_\-]*)|\*)?/gi,
2650 				/**	@ignore */
2651 				filter : function(matches, results, config) {
2652 					var originalResults = [].concat(results),
2653 						nodeName = matches[1] || '*',
2654 						x;
2655 					results.splice(0, results.length);
2656 					for (x=0; x<originalResults.length; x++) {
2657 						Array.prototype.splice.apply(results, [results.length-1,0].concat(self.toArray(originalResults[x].getElementsByTagName(nodeName))));
2658 					}
2659 				}
2660 			}
2661 		];

2664 		/** Resets a RegExp for repeated usage.
2665 		 *	@private
2666 		 */
2667 		resetRegex = function(regex) {
2668 			regex.lastIndex = 0;
2669 		};

2671 		
2672 		/**	@ignore */
2673 		function nativeQuerySelectorAll(selector, within) {
2674 			var results;
2675 			within = within || getElement.baseNode;
2676 			selector = selector.replace(/(\[[^\[\]= ]+=)([^\[\]"']+)(\])/gim,'$1"$2"$3');
2677 			try {
2678 				results = within.querySelectorAll(selector);
2679 				if (results) {
2680 					results = self.toArray(results);
2681 				}
2682 			} catch (err) {
2683 				self.log('Native querySelectorAll failed for selector: '+selector+', error:'+err.message);
2684 			}
2685 			return results || false;
2686 		}
2687 		
2688 		
2689 		/** The selector engine's interface. Returns an {Array} of elements matching the passed CSS selector query
2690 		 *	@param {String} search			A CSS selector, or multiple CSS selectors separated by a comma
2691 		 *	@param {Object} [options]		Optional hash of one-time triggers for the engine:
2692 		 *	@param {HTMLElement} [options.within=document]		Look for matches within the given element only
2693 		 *	@param {Boolean} [options.includeInvisibles=false]	Return #comment nodes, etc
2694 		 *	@param {Boolean} [options.logging=false]			Enable logging for this query
2695 		 *	@param {Boolean} [options.useCached=false]			Return a cached result if available
2696 		 *	@param {Boolean} [options.cache=false]				Cache the result
2697 		 *	@private
2698 		 */
2699 		getElement = function(search, options) {
2700 			var baseNode = getElement.baseNode || (getElement.baseNode = document && document.documentElement || document),
2701 				currentResults,
2702 				nodes,
2703 				nodeName,
2704 				originalSearch = search,
2705 				nativeSearch,
2706 				handlerConfig,
2707 				filterResponse,
2708 				searchParsed,
2709 				isMatch,
2710 				matches,
2711 				hasMatch,
2712 				constrainedToNode,
2713 				parseIterations = 0,
2714 				doLogging = false,
2715 				useCustomImplementation = !priv.support.querySelectorAll,
2716 				time = Date.now(),
2717 				perSelectorSearchTime,
2718 				perSelectorFilterTime,
2719 				i, x;
2720 			
2721 			// Sanitize input and options:
2722 			search = (search + '').replace(removePaddingReg, '$1');
2723 			options = puredom.extend({}, options || {});
2724 			if (options.logging===true) {
2725 				doLogging = true;
2726 			}
2727 			
2728 			// Check for cache enabled and return cached value if it exists:
2729 			if (cacheEnabled && options.useCache===true && cache[search]) {
2730 				return cache[search];
2731 			}
2732 			
2733 			// Allow queries to be constrained to a given base node:
2734 			if (options.within) {
2735 				baseNode = options.within;
2736 			}
2737 			
2738 			if (baseNode && baseNode.length && !baseNode.nodeName && baseNode.indexOf && baseNode[0]) {
2739 				baseNode = baseNode[0];
2740 			}
2741 			
2742 			
2743 			
2744 			// Comma-separated statements are dealt with in isolation, joined and returned:
2745 			if (search.indexOf(',')>-1) {
2746 				search = search.split(',');
2747 				// Get ready to store the combined result sets:
2748 				nodes = [];
2749 				for (x=search.length; x--; ) {
2750 					search[x] = search[x].replace(removePaddingReg,'$1');
2751 					if (search[x].length>0) {
2752 						// Re-run the engine for each independent selector chain:
2753 						matches = getElement(search[x], puredom.extend({}, options, {
2754 							logging : false,
2755 							internalLogging : doLogging,
2756 							internal : true
2757 						}));
2758 						// Combine results from each statement into one array:
2759 						if (matches) {
2760 							for (i=0; i<matches.length; i++) {
2761 								if (nodes.indexOf(matches[i])===-1) {
2762 									nodes.push(matches[i]);
2763 								}
2764 							}
2765 							//nodes = nodes.concat(matches);
2766 						}
2767 					}
2768 				}
2769 				if (doLogging) {
2770 					self.log('query=',originalSearch, ', result=',node);
2771 				}
2772 				// Return the combined results:
2773 				time = Date.now() - time;
2774 				if (time>100) {
2775 					self.log('Slow Selector Warning: "'+originalSearch+'" took ' + time + 'ms to complete.');
2776 				}
2777 				return nodes;
2778 			}
2779 			
2780 			
2781 			/** -------------------------
2782 			 *	Selector engine internals
2783 			 */
2784 			
2785 			// ID's bypass querySelectorAll and the custom engine so the expected document.getElementById() 
2786 			// functionality is preserved (only returns one element, the last with that ID).
2787 			if (search.match(/^#[^\s\[\]\(\)\:\*\.\,<>#]+$/gim)) {
2788 				currentResults = [
2789 					(baseNode.getElementById ? baseNode : document).getElementById(search.substring(1))
2790 				];
2791 				return currentResults;
2792 				// skip parse:
2793 				//useCustomImplementation = false;
2794 			}
2795 			
2796 			
2797 			nodeName = search.match(nodeNameReg);
2798 			nodeName = ((nodeName && nodeName[0]) || "").toLowerCase();
2799 			search = search.substring(nodeName.length);
2800 			// NOTE: trim() is intentionally NOT called on search here. We *want* to know if there 
2801 			// is preceeding whitespace, because that consitutes a "within" pseudo-pseudo-selector!
2802 			// ^ does that make sense?
2803 			
2804 			searchParsed = search;
2805 			
2806 			// querySelectorAll doesn't support searches beginning with the child selector. For those, use the custom engine.
2807 			if (originalSearch.charAt(0)==='>') {
2808 				useCustomImplementation = true;
2809 			}
2810 			
2811 			if (priv.support.querySelectorAll && useCustomImplementation!==true) {
2812 				currentResults = nativeQuerySelectorAll(originalSearch, baseNode);
2813 				if (currentResults===false) {
2814 					currentResults = [];
2815 					useCustomImplementation = true;
2816 				}
2817 			}
2818 			
2819 			
2820 			
2821 			if (useCustomImplementation) {
2822 				if (search.substring(0,1)==='#') {
2823 					currentResults = [];
2824 				}
2825 				else if ((!nodeName || nodeName==='*') && document.all && !window.opera && (baseNode===document || baseNode===document.documentElement)) {
2826 					currentResults = self.toArray(baseNode.all || document.all);
2827 					constrainedToNode = false;
2828 				}
2829 				else {
2830 					currentResults = self.toArray(baseNode.getElementsByTagName(nodeName || '*'));
2831 					constrainedToNode = true;
2832 				}
2833 				
2834 				// A pass-by-reference handlerConfig for filters will be needed for :not() support:
2835 				handlerConfig = {
2836 					searchBaseNode : baseNode,
2837 					negated : false,
2838 					first : true,
2839 					isFiltered : constrainedToNode || !!(nodeName && nodeName!=='*')
2840 				};
2841 				
2842 				
2843 				// Filter until there are no more selectors left in the statement:
2844 				while (searchParsed.length>0) {
2845 					parseIterations += 1;
2846 					hasMatch = false;
2847 					for (i=0; i<selectors.length; i++) {
2848 						if (enableSelectorStats===true) {
2849 							perSelectorSearchTime = Date.now();
2850 						}
2851 						
2852 						// Prepare and get matches from the selectorFilter's regular expression:
2853 						resetRegex(selectors[i].regex);
2854 						matches = selectors[i].regex.exec(searchParsed);
2855 						
2856 						if (enableSelectorStats===true) {
2857 							perSelectorSearchTime = Date.now() - perSelectorSearchTime;
2858 						}
2859 						
2860 						if (matches) {
2861 							// Match found, this must be the right selector filter:
2862 							hasMatch = true;
2863 							if (doLogging) {
2864 								self.log((selectors[i].title || selectors[i].regex) + ' ==>> matched:"'+ searchParsed.substring(0,matches[0].length) + '" ==>> remaining:"'+ searchParsed.substring(matches[0].length) + '" ||debug>> (submatches:'+ matches.slice(1).join(',') + ')');
2865 							}
2866 							
2867 							if (enableSelectorStats===true) {
2868 								perSelectorFilterTime = Date.now();
2869 							}
2870 							
2871 							// Allow the selector filter to filter the result set:
2872 							filterResponse = selectors[i].filter(matches, currentResults, handlerConfig);
2873 							if (filterResponse && self.isArray(filterResponse)) {
2874 								currentResults = filterResponse;
2875 							}
2876 							
2877 							if (enableSelectorStats===true) {
2878 								perSelectorFilterTime = Date.now() - perSelectorFilterTime;
2879 							}
2880 							
2881 							// Remove the matched selector from the front of the statement:
2882 							searchParsed = searchParsed.substring(matches[0].length);
2883 							
2884 							// We're no longer on the first match:
2885 							handlerConfig.first = false;
2886 							
2887 							// At least one filter has now been applied:
2888 							handlerConfig.isFiltered = true;
2889 						}
2890 						
2891 						// TODO: remove logging
2892 						if (enableSelectorStats===true) {
2893 							selectors[i].matchTimes.push(perSelectorSearchTime);
2894 							if (hasMatch) {
2895 								selectors[i].filterTimes.push(perSelectorFilterTime);
2896 							}
2897 						}
2898 						
2899 						// Drop out of the loop early if the selector is fully parsed (optimization):
2900 						if (searchParsed.length===0) {
2901 							break;
2902 						}
2903 					}
2904 					
2905 					// If no selector filters matched the statement, bail out. Otherwise causes an infinite loop.
2906 					if (!hasMatch) {
2907 						throw(new Error('puredom.getElement() :: Unknown CSS selector near: ' + searchParsed.substring(0,20), 'puredom.js', 2689));
2908 					}
2909 				}
2910 			}
2911 			
2912 			
2913 			if (options.includeInvisibles!==true) {
2914 				for (i=currentResults.length; i--; ) {
2915 					if (currentResults[i] && (currentResults[i].nodeName+'').charAt(0)==='#') {
2916 						currentResults.splice(i, 1);
2917 					}
2918 				}
2919 			}
2920 			
2921 			if (doLogging) {
2922 				self.log('query=',originalSearch, ', result=',currentResults);
2923 			}
2924 			
2925 			// Cache the results if enabled & requested:
2926 			if (cacheEnabled && options.cache===true) {
2927 				cache[search] = currentResults;
2928 			}
2929 			
2930 			if (options.internal!==true && doLogging===true) {
2931 				time = Date.now() - time;
2932 				if (time>10) {
2933 					self.log('Slow Selector Warning: "'+originalSearch+'" took ' + time + 'ms to complete. '+parseIterations+' parse iterations.');
2934 				}
2935 			}
2936 			
2937 			// Return the matched result set.  Can be empty, but is always an Array.
2938 			return currentResults;
2939 		};

3413 					}
3414 					return d.end();
3415 				}
3416 			};
3417 			evt.wrappedHandler.displayName = 'wrappedEventHandler_'+type;
3418 			evt.wrappedHandler.handler = handler;
3419 			evt.wrappedHandler.type = type;
3420 			evt.wrappedHandler.target = evt.target;		// an ID, not the node itself
3421 			evt.wrappedHandler.selector = selector;
3422 			this.list.push(evt);
3423 			obj = type = handler = evt = null;
3424 			return this.list[this.list.length-1].wrappedHandler;
3425 		}
3426 		
3427 	};

3432 	/** Get a String description of the subject for an event operation
3433 	 *	@private
3434 	 *	@param {Any} subject		An object of any type.
3435 	 */
3436 	priv.getSubjectDescription = function(obj) {
3437 		return (obj.nodeName ? (self.el(obj)+'') : (obj.constructor && obj.constructor.name || obj.name || obj)) + '';
3438 	};
