3441 	/**	Automatically translate DOM event types from [key] to [value] when registering or removing listeners. <br />
3442 	 *	Also falsifies corresponding puredom-wrapped events' type fields.
3443 	 *	@object
3444 	 */
3445 	self.eventTypeMap = {};
3446 	if (priv.support.webkitMultitouch) {
3447 		self.extend(self.eventTypeMap, {
3448 			'mousedown'	: 'touchstart',
3449 			'mousemove'	: 'touchmove',
3450 			'mouseup'	: 'touchend'
3451 		});
3452 	}
3453 	
3454 	/**	Add an event listener to a DOM node for the given event type.
3455 	 *	@private
3456 	 *	@param {HTMLElement} obj			An element to add the event listener to.
3457 	 *	@param {String} type				A type of event to register the listener for.
3458 	 *	@param {String} [selector]			Optionally call handler only if the target matches a CSS selector.
3459 	 *	@param {Function} handler			The listener function to register. Gets passed <code>({Event} event)</code>.
3460 	 */
3461 	self.addEvent = function(obj, type, selector, fn) {
3462 		var x, origType;
3463 		if (typeof selector==='function') {
3464 			fn = selector;
3465 			selector = null;
3466 		}
3467 		if (obj) {
3468 			if (self.typeOf(type)==='string' && type.indexOf(',')>-1) {
3469 				type = type.replace(/\s/gm,'').split(',');
3470 			}
3471 			if (self.isArray(type)) {
3472 				for (x=0; x<type.length; x++) {
3473 					self.addEvent(obj, type[x], selector, fn);
3474 				}
3475 				return true;
3476 			}
3477 			origType = type = (type+'').toLowerCase().replace(/^\s*(on)?(.*?)\s*$/gim,'$2');
3478 			
3479 			if (typeof type!=='string' || !fn || !fn.call) {
3480 				self.log('Attempted to add event with invalid type or handler:', {
3481 					type : type,
3482 					handler : fn+'',
3483 					subject : priv.getSubjectDescription(obj)
3484 				});
3485 				return;
3486 			}
3487 			
3488 			if (self.eventTypeMap.hasOwnProperty(type)) {
3489 				type = self.eventTypeMap[type];
3490 			}
3491 			
3492 			fn = priv.wrappedEventListener.create(origType, fn, obj, selector);
3493 			if (obj.attachEvent) {
3494 				obj.attachEvent('on' + type, fn);
3495 			}
3496 			else if (obj.addEventListener) {
3497 				obj.addEventListener(type, fn, false);
3498 				self._eventCount = (self._eventCount || 0) + 1;
3499 			}
3500 		}
3501 	};
3502 	
3503 	
3504 	/**	Remove an event listener from a DOM node.
3505 	 *	@private
3506 	 *	@param {Element} obj				An element to remove the event listener from.
3507 	 *	@param {String} type				The event type of the listener to be removed.
3508 	 *	@param {String} [selector]			Optionally call handler only if the target matches a CSS selector.
3509 	 *	@param {Function} handler			The listener function to remove.
3510 	 */
3511 	self.removeEvent = function(obj, type, selector, fn) {
3512 		var x, origType;
3513 		if (typeof selector==='function') {
3514 			fn = selector;
3515 			selector = null;
3516 		}
3517 		if (obj) {
3518 			if (self.typeOf(type)==='string' && type.indexOf(',')>-1) {
3519 				type = type.replace(/\s/gm,'').split(',');
3520 			}
3521 			if (self.isArray(type)) {
3522 				for (x=0; x<type.length; x++) {
3523 					self.removeEvent(obj, type[x], selector, fn);
3524 				}
3525 				return true;
3526 			}
3527 			origType = type = (type+'').toLowerCase().replace(/^\s*(on)?(.*?)\s*$/gim,'$2');
3528 			
3529 			if (typeof type!=='string' || !fn || !fn.call) {
3530 				self.log('Attempted to remove event with invalid type or handler:', {
3531 					type : type,
3532 					handler : fn+'',
3533 					subject : priv.getSubjectDescription(obj)
3534 				});
3535 				return;
3536 			}
3537 			
3538 			if (self.eventTypeMap.hasOwnProperty(type)) {
3539 				type = self.eventTypeMap[type];
3540 			}
3541 			
3542 			fn = priv.wrappedEventListener.get(origType, fn, obj, selector, true);
3543 			if (obj.detachEvent) {
3544 				obj.detachEvent('on' + type, fn);
3545 			}
3546 			else if (obj.removeEventListener) {
3547 				try {
3548 					obj.removeEventListener(type, fn, false);
3549 					self._eventCount = (self._eventCount || 0) - 1;
3550 				} catch(err) {}
3551 			}
3552 		}
3553 	};

3556 	/**	When called from within an event handler and passed the DOM Event, cancels the event, prevents the event's default action, and returns false.<br />
3557 	 *	<strong>Note:</strong> puredom-wrapped Event objects have a cancel() method that does this for you.
3558 	 *	@private
3559 	 *	@param {Event} event	A DOM Event.
3560 	 *	@returns false
3561 	 */
3562 	self.cancelEvent = function(e) {
3563 		e = e || window.event;
3564 		if (e) {
3565 			if (e.preventDefault) {
3566 				e.preventDefault();
3567 			}
3568 			if (e.stopPropagation) {
3569 				e.stopPropagation();
3570 			}
3571 			try {
3572 				e.cancelBubble = true;
3573 			} catch(err) {}
3574 			e.returnValue = false;
3575 		}
3576 		return false;
3577 	};

3602 	/**	Fire an event on a DOM node.
3603 	 *	@private
3604 	 *	@param {Object} options				An event options object, having at least a "type" and "target".
3605 	 *	@param {String} [options.type]		The event type to fire. "on"- prefixes get stripped.
3606 	 *	@param {String} [options.target]	A DOM node to fire the event on.
3607 	 *	@returns {Object} result description, with {Boolean} "rval" (false if any handler returned false), and {Boolean} "preventDefault" (default was prevented).
3608 	 */
3609 	self.fireEvent = function (options) {
3610 		var evt, rval, p, preventDefault, initError;
3611 		options = options || {};
3612 		if (document.createEventObject) {       // IE
3613 			options = self.extend({}, options);
3614 			options.type = 'on'+options.type.toLowerCase().replace(/^on/,'');
3615 			//priv.checkEventTypeSupport(options.target, options.type);
3616 			
3617 			try {
3618 				evt = document.createEventObject();
3619 			}catch(err) {
3620 				initError = true;
3621 			}
3622 			if (!initError) {
3623 				for (p in options) {
3624 					if (options.hasOwnProperty(p)) {
3625 						try {
3626 							evt[p] = options[p];
3627 						}catch(err){}
3628 					}
3629 				}
3630 				try {
3631 					rval = options.target.fireEvent(options.type, evt);
3632 					preventDefault = evt.preventDefault===true;
3633 				} catch(err) {
3634 					initError = true;
3635 				}
3636 			}
3637 			if (initError) {
3638 				//self.log('Error: Could not fire "' + options.type + '" event in IE. Falling back to internal implementation.');
3639 				if (priv.wrappedEventListener.internalFireEvent) {
3640 					priv.wrappedEventListener.internalFireEvent(options);
3641 				}
3642 			}
3643 			
3644 		}
3645 		else {                                  // Everything else
3646 			evt = document.createEvent("HTMLEvents");
3647 			evt.initEvent(options.type.toLowerCase().replace(/^on/,''), true, true);
3648 			for (p in options) {
3649 				if (options.hasOwnProperty(p)) {
3650 					try {
3651 						evt[p] = options[p];
3652 					} catch(err) {}
3653 				}
3654 			}
3655 			rval = !options.target.dispatchEvent(evt);
3656 			preventDefault = evt.preventDefault===true;
3657 		}
3658 		
3659 		return {
3660 			evt             : evt,
3661 			preventDefault  : preventDefault,
3662 			rval            : rval
3663 		};
3664 	};

3674 	priv._nodeToIdList = {};
3675 	
3676 	/**	Get the UUID value for a given node. If the node does not yet have a UUID, it is assigned one.
3677 	 *	@private
3678 	 */
3679 	priv.nodeToId = function(el) {
3680 		var search, id;
3681 		if (el===window) {
3682 			return '_td_autoid_window';
3683 		}
3684 		else if (el===document.documentElement) {
3685 			return '_td_autoid_html';
3686 		}
3687 		else if (el===document.body) {
3688 			return '_td_autoid_body';
3689 		}
3690 		search = (/\s_td_autoid_([0-9]+)\s/gm).exec(' ' + el.className + ' ');
3691 		if (search && search[1]) {
3692 			id = search[1];
3693 		}
3694 		else {
3695 			priv._nodeToIdIndex += 1;
3696 			id = priv._nodeToIdIndex + '';
3697 			self.addClass(el, '_td_autoid_'+id);
3698 		}
3699 		priv.ensureNodeIdListing(el, id);
3700 		return id;
3701 	};
3702 	
3703 	/**	Get the node with the given UUID.
3704 	 *	@private
3705 	 */
3706 	priv.idToNode = function(id) {
3707 		var search,
3708 			listed = priv._nodeToIdList[id+''],
3709 			node;
3710 		if (id==='_td_autoid_window') {
3711 			return window;
3712 		}
3713 		else if (id==='_td_autoid_html') {
3714 			return document.documentElement;
3715 		}
3716 		else if (id==='_td_autoid_body') {
3717 			return document.body;
3718 		}
3719 		if (listed) {
3720 			node = self.getElement(listed);
3721 			if (!(/\s_td_autoid_[0-9]+\s/gm).exec(' ' + node.className + ' ')) {
3722 				node = null;
3723 			}
3724 		}
3725 		if (!node) {
3726 			search = self.getElement('._td_autoid_'+id);
3727 			node = search && search[0];
3728 			if (node) {
3729 				priv.ensureNodeIdListing(node, id);
3730 			}
3731 		}
3732 		return node || false;
3733 	};
3734 	
3735 	/**	@private */
3736 	priv.ensureNodeIdListing = function(node, id) {
3737 		var idAttr;
3738 		if (node.getAttribute) {
3739 			idAttr = node.getAttribute('id');
3740 			if (!idAttr) {
3741 				idAttr = '_td_autoid_'+id;
3742 				node.setAttribute('id', idAttr);
3743 			}
3744 			priv._nodeToIdList[id] = '#'+idAttr;
3745 		}
3746 	};
3747 	
3748 	/**	@private */
3749 	priv.removeNodeUID = function(node) {
3750 		var id = node.getAttribute('id');
3751 		if (id && id.match(/^_td_autoid_[0-9]+$/g)) {
3752 			if (node.removeAttribute) {
3753 				node.removeAttribute('id');
3754 			}
3755 			else {
3756 				node.setAttribute('id', '');
3757 			}
3758 		}
3759 		if (node.className) {
3760 			node.className = node.className.replace(/(^|\b)_td_autoid_[0-9]+(\b|$)/gim,'');
3761 		}
3762 	};

3859 	/**	Set the opacity of an element.
3860 	 *	@private
3861 	 *	@param {HTMLElement} el		A DOM node to which an opacity value should be applied.
3862 	 *	@param {Number} opac		An integer opacity between 0 and 100, or a decimal value between 0.01 and 1.
3863 	 */
3864 	self.setOpacity = function(el, opac) {
3865 		if (opac<=1 && opac>0) {
3866 			opac = opac * 100;
3867 		}
3868 		opac = Math.round(opac);
3869 		if (opac<100) {
3870 			el.style.opacity = parseFloat(opac/100).toFixed(2);
3871 			el.style.filter = "alpha(opacity=" + opac + ")";
3872 		}
3873 		else {
3874 			el.style.opacity = null;
3875 			el.style.filter = null;
3876 		}
3877 	};

3881 	/**	Apply a Microsoft filter value to an element, retaining existing applied filters. <br />
3882 	 *	See: {@link http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms532853(v=vs.85).aspx}
3883 	 *	@private
3884 	 *	@param {HTMLElement} el		An element to apply a filter to.
3885 	 *	@param {String} type		A valid filter type.
3886 	 *	@param {String} value		The value to set for the given filter type.
3887 	 */
3888 	self.applyMsFilter = function(el, type, value) {
3889 		var item, filters,
3890 			valueStr = '',
3891 			ch = priv.support.filterProperty==='MsFilter' ? '"' : '',
3892 			p, a, i;
3893 		type = type.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + type.substring(1);
3894 		if (typeof value==='string') {
3895 			valueStr = value;
3896 			value = {};
3897 			a = valueStr.replace(/\s*(,|=)\s*      /gm,'$1').split(',');
3898 			for (p=0; p<a.length; p++) {
3899 				i = a[p].indexOf('=');
3900 				value[a[p].substring(0,i)] = a[p].substring(i+1);
3901 			}
3902 		}
3903 		else {
3904 			for (p in value) {
3905 				if (value.hasOwnProperty(p)) {
3906 					valueStr += ', '+p+'='+value[p];
3907 				}
3908 			}
3909 			valueStr = valueStr.replace(',','');
3910 		}
3911 		try {
3912 			item = el.filters && el.filters.item && (el.filters.item('DXImageTransform.Microsoft.'+type) || el.filters.item(type));
3913 		}catch(err){}
3914 		if (item) {
3915 			for (p in value) {
3916 				if (value.hasOwnProperty(p) && p!=='enabled') {
3917 					item[p] = value[p];
3918 				}
3919 			}
3920 			item.enabled = value.enabled?1:0;
3921 		}
3922 		else {
3923 			filters = el.style.MsFilter || el.style.filter || '';
3924 			filters += ' ' + (self.nodeStyle(el, 'MsFilter') || self.nodeStyle(el, 'filter') || '');
3925 			if (filters) {
3926 				filters = filters.replace(new RegExp('(^|\\s|\\))"?((progid\\:)?DXImageTransform\\.Microsoft\\.)?'+type+'\\s*?\\(.*?\\)"?\\s*?','gim'),'$1') + ' ';
3927 			}
3928 			el.style[priv.support.filterProperty] = filters + ch+'progid:DXImageTransform.Microsoft.'+type+'('+valueStr+')'+ch;
3929 		}
3930 		// hasLayout
3931 		if (!el.style.zoom) {
3932 			el.style.zoom = 1;
3933 		}
3934 	};

3939 	/**	@private */
3940 	var cssPropCache = {};
3941 	/**	@private */
3942 	function getPrefixedCssProperty(prop) {
3943 		var ret = prop,
3944 			p = cssPropCache[prop];
3945 		if (p) {
3946 			return p;
3947 		}
3948 		if (vendorCssPrefixJS && prop.substring(0, vendorCssPrefixJS.length)!==vendorCssPrefixJS) {
3949 			p = vendorCssPrefixJS + prop.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + prop.substring(1);
3950 			if (p in document.body.style) {
3951 				ret = p;
3952 			}
3953 		}
3954 		cssPropCache[prop] = ret;
3955 		return ret;
3956 	}

3959 	/**	Apply key-value CSS styles to an element.
3960 	 *	@param {HTMLElement} el		An element whose style should be updated.
3961 	 *	@param {Object} properties	An Object where keys are CSS properties and values are the corresponding CSS values to apply.
3962 	 *	@private
3963 	 */
3964 	self.applyCss = function(el, properties) {
3965 		var x, cx, d, p, ieOpac, vp;
3966 		properties = properties || {};
3967 		for (x in properties) {
3968 			if (properties.hasOwnProperty(x)) {
3969 				try {
3970 					cx = self.getStyleAsCSS(x);
3971 					cx = cx.replace(/^\-(moz|webkit|ms|o|vendor)\-/gim, vendorCssPrefix+'-');
3972 					cx = self.getStyleAsProperty(cx);
3973 					cx = getPrefixedCssProperty(cx);
3974 					if (cx==='opacity' && priv.support.filters) {
3975 						ieOpac = Math.round( parseFloat(properties[x])*100 );
3976 						if (ieOpac<100) {
3977 							self.applyMsFilter(el, 'alpha', {
3978 								enabled : true,
3979 								opacity : ieOpac
3980 							});
3981 						}
3982 						else {
3983 							self.applyMsFilter(el, 'alpha', {
3984 								enabled : false
3985 							});
3986 						}
3987 					}
3988 					else if (cx==='--box-shadow' && priv.support.filters) {
3989 						d = properties[x].match(/\b(\#[0-9af]{3}[0-9af]{3}?|rgba?\([0-9\,\s]+\))\b/gim);
3990 						d = d && d[0] || '';
3991 						p = (' '+properties[x]+' ').replace(d,'').replace(/\s+/m,' ').split(' ').slice(1,4);
3992 						self.applyMsFilter(el, 'glow', {
3993 							Color : d,
3994 							Strength : Math.round(p[3].replace(/[^0-9\-\.]/gim,''))
3995 						});
3996 					}
3997 					else {
3998 						el.style[cx] = properties[x];
3999 					}
4000 				}catch(err){}
4001 			}
4002 		}
4003 	};

4005 	/**	Convert a CSS property name to it's CamelCase equivalent.
4006 	 *	@private
4007 	 */
4008 	self.getStyleAsProperty = function(style) {
4009 		if (typeof style!=='string') {
4010 			return null;
4011 		}
4012 		style = style.replace(/\-[a-z0-9]/gim, priv.styleAsPropReplacer);
4013 		// fixes "webkitFoo" -> "WebkitFoo" etc
4014 		style = style.replace(/^(webkit|moz|ms|o)[A-Z]/gm, priv.styleAsPropVendorPrefixReplacer);
4015 		return style;
4016 	};
4017 	/**	@private */
4018 	priv.styleAsPropReplacer = function(s) {
4019 		return s.charAt(1).toUpperCase();
4020 	};
4021 	/**	@private */
4022 	priv.styleAsPropVendorPrefixReplacer = function(s) {
4023 		return s.charAt(0).toUpperCase()+s.substring(1);
4024 	};

4026 	/**	Convert a CSS property name to it's css-dash-separated equivalent.
4027 	 *	@private
4028 	 */
4029 	self.getStyleAsCSS = function(style) {
4030 		return typeof style==='string' && style.replace(/\-*([A-Z])/gm, '-$1').toLowerCase() || null;
4031 	};

4033 	/**	Parse a CSS String and return an Object representation.
4034 	 *	@private
4035 	 */
4036 	priv.parseCSS = function(css) {
4037 		var tokenizer = /\s*([a-z\-]+)\s*:\s*([^;]*?)\s*(?:;|$)/gi,
4038 			obj, token;
4039 		if (css) {
4040 			obj = {};
4041 			tokenizer.lastIndex = 0;
4042 			while ((token=tokenizer.exec(css))) {
4043 				obj[self.getStyleAsProperty(token[1])] = token[2];
4044 			}
4045 		}
4046 		return obj;
4047 	};
4048 	
4049 	self._parseCss = priv.parseCSS;

4051 	/** Some intense CSS3 transitions wrapping, needed in order to support animating multiple
4052 	 *	properties asynchronously with interjected transition modifications
4053 	 *	@private
4054 	 */
4055 	self.getCssTransitions = function(el) {
4056 		var transitions = {},
4057 			current = {
4058 				properties			: '-vendor-transition-property',
4059 				durations			: '-vendor-transition-duration',
4060 				timingFunctions		: '-vendor-transition-timing-function'
4061 			},
4062 			p, x, durationStr, duration;
4063 		for (p in current) {
4064 			if (current.hasOwnProperty(p)) {
4065 				current[p] = (self.nodeStyle(el, current[p]) || '').replace(/\s/,'').split(',');
4066 			}
4067 		}
4068 		for (x=0; x<current.properties.length; x++) {
4069 			if (current.properties[x] && current.properties[x]!=='null' && !(current.properties[x]==='all' && current.durations[x].match(/^[0\.ms]*$/))) {
4070 				durationStr = current.durations[x] || current.durations[current.durations.length-1];
4071 				duration = parseFloat(durationStr.replace(/[^\-0-9\.]/gim,'')) || 0;
4072 				if (!durationStr.match(/ms$/i)) {
4073 					duration *= 1000;
4074 				}
4075 				transitions[self.getStyleAsProperty(current.properties[x])] = {
4076 					duration : duration,
4077 					timingFunction : current.timingFunctions[x] || current.timingFunctions[current.timingFunctions.length-1] || 'ease'
4078 				};
4079 			}
4080 		}
4081 		
4082 		return transitions;
4083 	};
4084 	
4085 	/** @private */
4086 	self.setCssTransitions = function(el, transitions) {
4087 		var css = {
4088 				'-vendor-transition-property'			: [],
4089 				'-vendor-transition-duration'			: [],
4090 				'-vendor-transition-timing-function'	: []
4091 			},
4092 			p;
4093 		
4094 		for (p in transitions) {
4095 			if (transitions.hasOwnProperty(p) && transitions[p]) {
4096 				css['-vendor-transition-property'].push(p.toLowerCase());
4097 				css['-vendor-transition-duration'].push((transitions[p].duration/1000).toFixed(3) + 's');
4098 				css['-vendor-transition-timing-function'].push(transitions[p].timingFunction || 'ease');
4099 			}
4100 		}
4101 		
4102 		for (p in css) {
4103 			if (css.hasOwnProperty(p)) {
4104 				css[p] = css[p].join(', ');
4105 			}
4106 		}
4107 		
4108 		self.applyCss(el, css);
4109 	};
4110 	
4111 	/** @private */
4112 	self.updateCssTransitions = function(el, transitionsToUpdate) {
4113 		var transitions, p;
4114 		if (transitionsToUpdate) {
4115 			transitions = self.getCssTransitions(el);
4116 			for (p in transitionsToUpdate) {
4117 				if (transitionsToUpdate.hasOwnProperty(p)) {
4118 					if (transitionsToUpdate[p]) {
4119 						transitions[p] = transitionsToUpdate[p];
4120 					}
4121 					else {
4122 						delete transitions[p];
4123 					}
4124 				}
4125 			}
4126 			self.setCssTransitions(el, transitions);
4127 		}
4128 	};

4131 	/** @private */
4132 	self.addClass = function(el, classes, remove) {
4133 		var modified = false,
4134 			list, index, i;
4135 		if (classes) {
4136 			if (!self.isArray(classes)) {
4137 				classes = [classes];
4138 			}
4139 			list = (el.className || '').split(/\s+/);
4140 			for (i=0; i<classes.length; i++) {
4141 				index = list.indexOf(classes[i]);
4142 				if (remove!==true && index===-1) {
4143 					modified = true;
4144 					list.push( classes[i] );
4145 				}
4146 				else if (remove===true && index>-1) {
4147 					modified = true;
4148 					list.splice(index, 1);
4149 				}
4150 			}
4151 			if (modified) {
4152 				el.className = list.join(' ');
4153 			}
4154 		}
4155 	};
4156 	
4157 	/** @private */
4158 	self.removeClass = function(el, classes) {
4159 		return self.addClass(el, classes, true);
4160 	};

4162 	/** Get the current value of a CSS property from the given node. 
4163 	 *	@private
4164 	 */
4165 	self.nodeStyle = function(node, property) {
4166 		var dashed = (property+'').replace(/[A-Z]/g, '-$0').toLowerCase(),
4167 			camelized,
4168 			filter,
4169 			s,
4170 			style;
4171 		
4172 		dashed = dashed.replace(/^\-(moz|webkit|ms|o|vendor)\-/gim, vendorCssPrefix+'-');
4173 		camelized = dashed.replace(/\-[a-z]/gim, function (s) {return s.substring(1).toUpperCase();});
4174 		
4175 		if (dashed==='opacity' && priv.support.filters) {
4176 			return node.filters.alpha && node.filters.alpha.enabled!==false && Math.round(node.filters.alpha.opacity)/100;
4177 		}
4178 		
4179 		if (node.style && node.style[camelized]) {
4180 			style = node.style[camelized] || '';
4181 		}
4182 	
4183 		else if (node.currentStyle && node.currentStyle[camelized]) {
4184 			style = node.currentStyle[camelized] || node.currentStyle[dashed] || '';
4185 		}
4186 	
4187 		else if (document.defaultView && document.defaultView.getComputedStyle) {
4188 			s = document.defaultView.getComputedStyle(node, null);
4189 			style = s && (s.getPropertyValue(dashed) || s.getPropertyValue(camelized)) || '';
4190 		}
4191 	
4192 		else if (window.getComputedStyle) {
4193 			s = window.getComputedStyle(node, null);
4194 			style = s && (s.getPropertyValue(dashed) || s.getPropertyValue(camelized)) || '';
4195 		}
4196 		
4197 		return style;
4198 	};

4224 	/**	Add a new plugin method to {puredom.NodeSelection}. <br />
4225 	 *	When called, a plugin function gets passed the arguments supplied by the caller. <br />
4226 	 *	The value of <code>this</code> within the function is the selection ({@link puredom.NodeSelection}) it was called on.
4227 	 *	@param {String} name		A method name to define on {puredom.NodeSelection}
4228 	 *	@param {Function} func		The plugin method to define.
4229 	 */
4230 	self.addNodeSelectionPlugin = function(name, func) {
4231 		if (!self.NodeSelection.prototype.hasOwnProperty(name)) {
4232 			self.NodeSelection.prototype[name] = function() {
4233 				var ret = func.apply(this, arguments);
4234 				if (ret===null || ret===undefined) {
4235 					return this;
4236 				}
4237 				return ret;
4238 			};
4239 		}
4240 	};

4248 			initialized = true;
4249 			
4250 			self.forEach(priv.oninit, function(i) {
4251 				i.call(self, self);
4252 			});
4253 			
4254 			self.fireEvent({
4255 				target : document.body,
4256 				type : "puredomready",
4257 				puredom : self
4258 			});
4259 		}
4260 	};
4261 	self.addEvent(document, "DOMContentLoaded", self.init);
4262 	self.addEvent(window, "load", self.init);
4263 	self.addEvent(window, "unload", priv.unload);

4281 	priv.puredom = function(i) {
4282 		if (self.typeOf(i)==='function') {
4283 			if (initialized===true) {
4284 				i.call(self, self);
4285 			}
4286 			else {
4287 				priv.oninit.push(i);
4288 			}
4289 			return self;
4290 		}
4291 		else {
4292 			return self.el.apply(self, arguments);
4293 		}
4294 	};
